content: 60 He abandoned the sanctuary of Shiloh, the tent where he had lived among people.

title: Psalms 78:61
content: 61 He allowed his strength to be captured and gave his glory into the enemy’s hand.

title: Psalms 78:62
content: 62 He handed his people over to the sword, and he was angry with his heritage.

title: Psalms 78:63
content: 63 Fire devoured their young men, and their young women had no wedding songs.

title: Psalms 78:64
content: 64 Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.

title: Psalms 78:65
content: 65 Then the Lord awakened as one from sleep, like a warrior who shouts because of wine.

title: Psalms 78:66
content: 66 He drove his adversaries back; he put them to everlasting shame.

title: Psalms 78:67
content: 67 He rejected the tent of Joseph, and he did not chose the tribe of Ephraim.

title: Psalms 78:68
content: 68 He chose the tribe of Judah and Mount Zion that he loved.

title: Psalms 78:69
content: 69 He built his sanctuary like the heavens, like the earth that he has established forever.

title: Psalms 78:70
content: 70 He chose David, his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.

title: Psalms 78:71
content: 71 He took him from following the ewes with their young, and he brought him to be shepherd of Jacob, his people, and of Israel, his heritage.

title: Psalms 78:72
content: 72 David shepherded them with the integrity of his heart, and he guided them with the skill of his hands.

title: Psalms 79:1
content: 1 A psalm of Asaph. A Psalm of Asaph God, foreign nations have come into your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple; they have turned Jerusalem into a heap of ruins.

title: Psalms 79:2
content: 2 They have given the dead bodies of your servants as food to the birds of the skies, the bodies of your faithful ones to the beasts of the earth.

title: Psalms 79:3
content: 3 They have shed their blood like water around Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.

title: Psalms 79:4
content: 4 We have become a reproach for our neighbors, mocking and derision to those who are around us.

title: Psalms 79:5
content: 5 How long, Yahweh? Will you stay angry forever? How long will your jealous anger burn like fire?

title: Psalms 79:6
content: 6 Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not know you and on the kingdoms that do not call upon your name.

title: Psalms 79:7
content: 7 For they have devoured Jacob and destroyed his villages.

title: Psalms 79:8
content: 8 Do not hold the sins of our forefathers against us; may your merciful actions come to us, for we are very low.

title: Psalms 79:9
content: 9 Help us, God of our salvation, for the sake of the glory of your name; save us and forgive our sins for your name’s sake.

title: Psalms 79:10
content: 10 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” May the blood of your servants that was shed be avenged on the nations before our eyes.

title: Psalms 79:11
content: 11 May the groans of the prisoners come before you; with the greatness of your power keep the children of death alive.

title: Psalms 79:12
content: 12 Pay back into the laps of our neighboring countries seven times as much as the insults with which they have insulted you, Lord.

title: Psalms 79:13
content: 13 So we your people and sheep of your pasture will give you thanks forever. We will tell your praises to all generations.

title: Psalms 80:1
content: 1 For the chief musician, set to the Shoshannim Eduth style. A psalm of Asaph. Pay attention, Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock; you who sit above the cherubim, shine on us!

title: Psalms 80:2
content: 2 In the sight of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up your power; come and save us.

title: Psalms 80:3
content: 3 God, restore us; make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.

title: Psalms 80:4
content: 4 Yahweh God of hosts, how long will you be angry at your people when they pray?

title: Psalms 80:5
content: 5 You have fed them with the bread of tears and given them tears to drink in great quantities.

title: Psalms 80:6
content: 6 You make us something for our neighbors to argue over, and our enemies laugh about us among themselves.

title: Psalms 80:7
content: 7 God of hosts, restore us; make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.

title: Psalms 80:8
content: 8 You brought a vine out of Egypt; you drove out nations and transplanted it.

title: Psalms 80:9
content: 9 You cleared the land for it; it took root and filled the land.

title: Psalms 80:10
content: 10 The mountains were covered with its shade, the cedars of God by its branches.

title: Psalms 80:11
content: 11 It sent out its branches as far as the sea and its shoots to the Euphrates River.

title: Psalms 80:12
content: 12 Why have you broken down its walls so that all who pass by along the road pluck its fruit?

title: Psalms 80:13
content: 13 The boars out of the forest ruin it, and the beasts of the field feed on it.

title: Psalms 80:14
content: 14 Turn back, God of hosts; look down from heaven and take notice and take care of this vine.

title: Psalms 80:15
content: 15 This is the root that your right hand planted, the shoot that you made to grow.

title: Psalms 80:16
content: 16 It has been burned and cut down; they perish because of your rebuke.

title: Psalms 80:17
content: 17 May your hand be on the man of your right hand, on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.

title: Psalms 80:18
content: 18 Then we will not turn away from you; revive us, and we will call on your name.

title: Psalms 80:19
content: 19 Yahweh God of hosts, restore us; make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.

title: Psalms 81:1
content: 1 For the chief musician; set to the Gittith style. A psalm of Asaph. Sing aloud to God our strength; shout out for joy to the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms 81:2
content: 2 Sing a song and play the tambourine, the pleasant lyre with the harp.

title: Psalms 81:3
content: 3 Blow the trumpet on the day of the new moon, on the day of the full moon, when our feast day begins.

title: Psalms 81:4
content: 4 For it is a statute for Israel, a decree given by the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms 81:5
content: 5 He issued it as a regulation in Joseph when he went against the land of Egypt, where I heard a voice that I did not recognize:

title: Psalms 81:6
content: 6 “I removed the burden from his shoulder; his hands were freed from holding the basket.

title: Psalms 81:7
content: 7 In your distress you called out, and I helped you; I answered you from a dark thundercloud. I tested you at the waters of Meribah.

title: Psalms 81:8
content: 8 Listen, my people, for I will warn you, Israel, if you would only listen to me!

title: Psalms 81:9
content: 9 There must be no foreign god among you; you must not worship any foreign god.

title: Psalms 81:10
content: 10 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.

title: Psalms 81:11
content: 11 But my people did not listen to my words; Israel did not obey me.

title: Psalms 81:12
content: 12 So I gave them over to their own stubborn way so that they might do what seemed right to them.

title: Psalms 81:13
content: 13 Oh, that my people would listen to me; oh, that my people would walk in my paths.

title: Psalms 81:14
content: 14 Then I would quickly subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their oppressors.

title: Psalms 81:15
content: 15 May those who hate Yahweh cringe in fear before him! May they be humiliated forever.

title: Psalms 81:16
content: 16 I would feed Israel with the finest wheat; I would satisfy you with honey out of the rock.”

title: Psalms 82:1
content: 1 A psalm of Asaph. A Psalm of Asaph God stands in the divine assembly; in the midst of the gods he renders judgment.

title: Psalms 82:2
content: 2 How long will you judge unjustly and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah

title: Psalms 82:3
content: 3 Defend the poor and fatherless; maintain the rights of the afflicted and destitute.

title: Psalms 82:4
content: 4 Rescue the poor and needy; take them out of the hand of the wicked.

title: Psalms 82:5
content: 5 They neither know nor understand; they wander around in the darkness; all the foundations of the earth crumble.

title: Psalms 82:6
content: 6 I said, “You are gods, and all of you sons of the Most High.

title: Psalms 82:7
content: 7 Nevertheless you will die like men and fall like one of the princes.”

title: Psalms 82:8
content: 8 Arise, God, judge the earth, for you have an inheritance in all the nations.

title: Psalms 83:1
content: 1 A song. A psalm of Asaph. God, do not be silent! Do not ignore us and remain unmoved, God.

title: Psalms 83:2
content: 2 Look, your enemies are making a commotion, and those who hate you have raised their heads.

title: Psalms 83:3
content: 3 They conspire against your people and plan together against your protected ones.

title: Psalms 83:4
content: 4 They have said, “Come, and let us destroy them as a nation. Then the name of Israel will no longer be remembered.”

title: Psalms 83:5
content: 5 They schemed together with one strategy; they made an alliance against you—

title: Psalms 83:6
content: 6 the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, of Moab and the Hagrites,

title: Psalms 83:7
content: 7 Gebal, Ammon, Amalek; and also Philistia and the inhabitants of Tyre.

title: Psalms 83:8
content: 8 Assyria also has joined with them; they have become an arm for the descendants of Lot.

title: Psalms 83:9
content: 9 Do to them as you did to Midian, as you did to Sisera and to Jabin at the Kishon River.

title: Psalms 83:10
content: 10 They perished at Endor and became like manure for the earth.

title: Psalms 83:11
content: 11 Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna.

title: Psalms 83:12
content: 12 They said, “Let us take for ourselves the pastures of God.”

title: Psalms 83:13
content: 13 My God, make them like the whirling dust, like chaff before the wind,

title: Psalms 83:14
content: 14 like the fire that burns the forest, and like the flame that sets the mountains on fire.

title: Psalms 83:15
content: 15 Chase them with your strong wind, and terrify them with your windstorm.

title: Psalms 83:16
content: 16 Fill their faces with shame so that they might seek your name, Yahweh.

title: Psalms 83:17
content: 17 May they be put to shame and be terrified forever; may they perish in disgrace.

title: Psalms 83:18
content: 18 Then they will know that you alone, Yahweh, are honored as the Most High over all the earth.

title: Psalms 84:1
content: 1 For the chief musician; set to the Gittith style. A psalm of the sons of Korah. How lovely is the place where you live, Yahweh of hosts!

title: Psalms 84:2
content: 2 I long for the courts of Yahweh, my desire for it has made me exhausted. My heart and all of my being call out to the living God.

title: Psalms 84:3
content: 3 Even the sparrow has found her a house and the swallow a nest for herself where she may lay her young near your altars, Yahweh of hosts, my King, and my God.

title: Psalms 84:4
content: 4 Blessed are they who live in your house; they praise you continually.

title: Psalms 84:5
content: 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in you, in whose heart are the highways up to Zion.

title: Psalms 84:6
content: 6 Passing through the Valley of Tears, they find springs of water to drink. The early rains cover it with blessings.

title: Psalms 84:7
content: 7 They go from strength to strength; every one of them appears before God in Zion.

title: Psalms 84:8
content: 8 Yahweh God of hosts, hear my prayer; God of Jacob, listen to what I am saying!

title: Psalms 84:9
content: 9 God, watch over our shield; show concern for your anointed.

title: Psalms 84:10
content: 10 For one day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to live within the tents of the wicked.

title: Psalms 84:11
content: 11 For Yahweh God is our sun and shield; Yahweh will give grace and glory; he does not withhold any good thing from those who walk in integrity.

title: Psalms 84:12
content: 12 Yahweh of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in you.

title: Psalms 85:1
content: 1 For the chief musician. A psalm of the sons of Korah. Yahweh, you have showed favor to your land; you have restored the well-being of Jacob.

title: Psalms 85:2
content: 2 You have forgiven the sin of your people; you have covered all their sin. Selah

title: Psalms 85:3
content: 3 You have withdrawn all your wrath; you have turned back from your hot anger.

title: Psalms 85:4
content: 4 Restore us, God of our salvation, and let go of your displeasure with us.

title: Psalms 85:5
content: 5 Will you be angry with us forever? Will you remain angry throughout future generations?

title: Psalms 85:6
content: 6 Will you not revive us again? Then your people will rejoice in you.

title: Psalms 85:7
content: 7 Show us your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, grant us your salvation.

title: Psalms 85:8
content: 8 I will listen to what Yahweh God says, for he will make peace with his people, his faithful ones. Yet they must not turn again to foolish ways.

title: Psalms 85:9
content: 9 Surely his salvation is near to those who fear him; then glory will remain in our land.

title: Psalms 85:10
content: 10 Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness have met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

title: Psalms 85:11
content: 11 Trustworthiness springs up from the ground, and righteousness looks down from the sky.

title: Psalms 85:12
content: 12 Yes, Yahweh will give his good blessings, and our land will yield its crops.

title: Psalms 85:13
content: 13 Righteousness will go before him and make a way for his footsteps.

title: Psalms 86:1
content: 1 A prayer of David. A Prayer of David. Incline your ear and listen, Yahweh, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.

title: Psalms 86:2
content: 2 Protect me, for I am faithful; my God, save your servant who trusts in you.

title: Psalms 86:3
content: 3 Be merciful to me, Lord, for I cry out to you all day long.

title: Psalms 86:4
content: 4 Make your servant glad, for to you, Lord, I lift up my soul.

title: Psalms 86:5
content: 5 You, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive, and you show great mercy to all those who cry out to you.

title: Psalms 86:6
content: 6 Yahweh, listen to my prayer; hear the sound of my pleas.

title: Psalms 86:7
content: 7 In the day of my trouble I call on you, for you will answer me.

title: Psalms 86:8
content: 8 There is no one who compares to you among the gods, Lord. There are no deeds like your deeds.

title: Psalms 86:9
content: 9 All the nations that you have made will come and bow before you, Lord. They will honor your name.

title: Psalms 86:10
content: 10 For you are great and do wonderful things; you only are God.

title: Psalms 86:11
content: 11 Teach me your ways, Yahweh. Then I will walk in your truth. Unite my heart to reverence you.

title: Psalms 86:12
content: 12 Lord my God, I will praise you with my whole heart; I will glorify your name forever.

title: Psalms 86:13
content: 13 For great is your covenant faithfulness toward me; you have rescued my life from the depths of Sheol.

title: Psalms 86:14
content: 14 God, the arrogant have risen up against me. A gang of violent men seek my life. They have no regard for you.

title: Psalms 86:15
content: 15 But you, Lord, are a merciful and gracious God, slow to anger, and abundant in covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness.

title: Psalms 86:16
content: 16 Turn toward me and have mercy on me; give your strength to your servant; save the son of your servant woman.

title: Psalms 86:17
content: 17 Show me a sign of your favor. Then those who hate me will see it and be put to shame because you, Yahweh, have helped me and comforted me.

title: Psalms 87:1
content: 1 A psalm of the sons of Korah; a song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah A Song On the holy mount stands the city he founded;

title: Psalms 87:2
content: 2 Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the tents of Jacob.

title: Psalms 87:3
content: 3 Glorious things are said of you, city of God. Selah

title: Psalms 87:4
content: 4 “I mention Rahab and Babylon to my followers. See, there are Philistia, and Tyre, along with Cush— and will say, ‘This one was born there.’”

title: Psalms 87:5
content: 5 Of Zion it will be said, “Each of these was born in her; and the Most High himself will establish her.”

title: Psalms 87:6
content: 6 Yahweh writes in the census book of the nations, “This one was born there.”

title: Psalms 87:7
content: 7 So also the singers and the dancers say together, “All my fountains are in you.”

title: Psalms 88:1
content: 1 A song, a psalm of the sons of Korah; for the chief musician; set to the Mahalath Leannoth style. A maschil of Heman the Ezrahite. Yahweh, God of my salvation, I cry out day and night before you.

title: Psalms 88:2
content: 2 Let my prayer come before you; pay attention to my cry.

title: Psalms 88:3
content: 3 For I am filled with troubles, and my life has reached Sheol.

title: Psalms 88:4
content: 4 People treat me like those who go down into the pit; I am a man with no strength.

title: Psalms 88:5
content: 5 I am abandoned among the dead; I am like the dead who lie in the grave, about whom you care no more because they are cut off from your power.

title: Psalms 88:6
content: 6 You place me in the lowest part of the pit, in the dark and deep places.

title: Psalms 88:7
content: 7 Your wrath lies heavy on me, and all your waves crash over me.

title: Psalms 88:8
content: 8 Because of you, my acquaintances avoid me. You have made me a shocking sight to them. I am hemmed in and I cannot escape.

title: Psalms 88:9
content: 9 My eyes grow weary from trouble; All day long I call out to you, Yahweh; I spread out my hands to you.

title: Psalms 88:10
content: 10 Will you do wonders for the dead? Will those who have died rise and praise you?

title: Psalms 88:11
content: 11 Will your covenant faithfulness be proclaimed in the grave, your loyalty in the place of the dead?

title: Psalms 88:12
content: 12 Will your wonderful deeds be known in the darkness, or your righteousness in the place of forgetfulness?

title: Psalms 88:13
content: 13 But I cry to you, Yahweh; in the morning my prayer comes before you.

title: Psalms 88:14
content: 14 Yahweh, why do you reject me? Why do you hide your face from me?

title: Psalms 88:15
content: 15 I have always been afflicted and on the verge of death since my youth. I have suffered from your terrors; I am in despair.

title: Psalms 88:16
content: 16 Your angry actions have passed over me, and your terrifying deeds have annihilated me.

title: Psalms 88:17
content: 17 They surround me like water all the day long; they have all encircled me.

title: Psalms 88:18
content: 18 You have removed every friend and acquaintance from me. My only acquaintance is the darkness.

title: Psalms 89:1
content: 1 A maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite. I will sing of Yahweh’s acts of covenant faithfulness forever. I will proclaim your truthfulness to future generations.

title: Psalms 89:2
content: 2 For I have said, “Covenant faithfulness has been established forever; your truthfulness you have established in the heavens.”

title: Psalms 89:3
content: 3 “I have made a covenant with my chosen one, I have made an oath to David my servant.

title: Psalms 89:4
content: 4 I will establish your descendants forever, and I will establish your throne through all generations.”

title: Psalms 89:5
content: 5 The heavens praise your wonders, Yahweh; your truthfulness is praised in the assembly of the holy ones.

title: Psalms 89:6
content: 6 For who in the skies can be compared to Yahweh? Who among the sons of the gods is like Yahweh?

title: Psalms 89:7
content: 7 He is a God who is greatly honored in the council of the holy ones and is awesome among all who surround him.

title: Psalms 89:8
content: 8 Yahweh God of hosts, who is strong like you, Yahweh? Your truthfulness surrounds you.

title: Psalms 89:9
content: 9 You rule the raging sea; when the waves surge, you calm them.

title: Psalms 89:10
content: 10 You crushed Rahab as one who is killed. You scattered your enemies with your strong arm.

title: Psalms 89:11
content: 11 The heavens belong to you, and the earth also. You made the world and all it contains.

title: Psalms 89:12
content: 12 You created the north and the south. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.

title: Psalms 89:13
content: 13 You have a mighty arm and a strong hand, and your right hand is high.

title: Psalms 89:14
content: 14 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness come before you.

title: Psalms 89:15
content: 15 Blessed are the people who know the joyful sound! Yahweh, they walk in the light of your face.

title: Psalms 89:16
content: 16 They rejoice in your name all day long, and in your righteousness they exalt you.

title: Psalms 89:17
content: 17 You are their majestic strength, and by your favor our strength is made victorious.

title: Psalms 89:18
content: 18 For our shield belongs to Yahweh; our king belongs to the Holy One of Israel.

title: Psalms 89:19
content: 19 Long ago you spoke in a vision to your faithful ones; I have raised up one chosen from among the people.

title: Psalms 89:20
content: 20 I have chosen David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him.

title: Psalms 89:21
content: 21 My hand will support him. Also my arm will be with him to strengthen him.

title: Psalms 89:22
content: 22 No enemy will deceive him; no son of wickedness will oppress him.

title: Psalms 89:23
content: 23 I will crush his enemies before him; I will kill those who hate him.

title: Psalms 89:24
content: 24 My truth and my covenant faithfulness will be with him; by my name he will win victories.

title: Psalms 89:25
content: 25 I will place his hand over the sea and his right hand over the rivers.

title: Psalms 89:26
content: 26 He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.’

title: Psalms 89:27
content: 27 I also will place him as my firstborn son, the most exalted of the kings of the earth.

title: Psalms 89:28
content: 28 I will extend my covenant faithfulness to him forever; and my covenant with him will be secure.

title: Psalms 89:29
content: 29 I will make his descendants endure forever and his throne as enduring as the skies above.

title: Psalms 89:30
content: 30 If his children forsake my law and do not walk in my regulations,

title: Psalms 89:31
content: 31 if they break my rules and do not keep my commands,

title: Psalms 89:32
content: 32 then will I punish their rebellion with a rod and their iniquity with blows.

title: Psalms 89:33
content: 33 But I will not remove my steadfast love from him or be unfaithful to my promise.

title: Psalms 89:34
content: 34 I will not break my covenant or change the words of my lips.

title: Psalms 89:35
content: 35 Once and for all I have sworn by my holiness— I will not lie to David:

title: Psalms 89:36
content: 36 his descendants will continue forever and his throne as long as the sun before me.

title: Psalms 89:37
content: 37 It will be established forever like the moon, the faithful witness in the sky.”

title: Psalms 89:38
content: 38 But you have refused and rejected; you have been angry with your anointed king.

title: Psalms 89:39
content: 39 You have renounced the covenant of your servant. You have desecrated his crown on the ground.

title: Psalms 89:40
content: 40 You have broken down all his walls. You have ruined his strongholds.

title: Psalms 89:41
content: 41 All who pass by have robbed him. He has become an object of disgust to his neighbors.

title: Psalms 89:42
content: 42 You have raised the right hand of his enemies; you have made all his enemies rejoice.

title: Psalms 89:43
content: 43 You turn back the edge of his sword and have not made him stand when in battle.

title: Psalms 89:44
content: 44 You have brought his splendor to an end; you have brought down his throne to the ground.

title: Psalms 89:45
content: 45 You have shortened the days of his youth. You have covered him with shame.

title: Psalms 89:46
content: 46 How long, Yahweh? Will you hide yourself, forever? How long will your anger burn like fire?

title: Psalms 89:47
content: 47 Oh, think about how short my time is, and for what uselessness you have created all the children of mankind!

title: Psalms 89:48
content: 48 Who can live and not see death, or rescue his own life from the hand of Sheol?

title: Psalms 89:49
content: 49 Lord, where are your former acts of covenant faithfulness that you swore to David in your truthfulness?

title: Psalms 89:50
content: 50 Call to mind, Lord, the mocking directed against your servants and how I bear in my heart so many insults from the nations.

title: Psalms 89:51
content: 51 Your enemies hurl insults, Yahweh; they mock the footsteps of your anointed one.

title: Psalms 89:52
content: 52 Blessed be Yahweh forever. Amen and Amen.

title: Psalms 90:1
content: 1 A prayer of Moses the man of God. A Prayer of Moses a man of God Lord, you have been our refuge throughout all generations.

title: Psalms 90:2
content: 2 Before the mountains were formed, or you formed the earth and the world, from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.

title: Psalms 90:3
content: 3 You return man to dust, and you say, “Return, you descendants of mankind.”

title: Psalms 90:4
content: 4 For a thousand years in your sight are as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.

title: Psalms 90:5
content: 5 You sweep them away as with a flood and they sleep; in the morning they are like the grass that sprouts up.

title: Psalms 90:6
content: 6 In the morning it blooms and grows up; in the evening it withers and dries up.

title: Psalms 90:7
content: 7 Truly, we are consumed in your anger, and in your wrath we are terrified.

title: Psalms 90:8
content: 8 You have set our iniquities before you, our hidden sins in the light of your presence.

title: Psalms 90:9
content: 9 For our life passes away under your wrath; our years quickly pass like a sigh.

title: Psalms 90:10
content: 10 Our years are seventy, or even eighty if we are healthy; but even our best years are marked by trouble and sorrow. Yes, they pass quickly, and we fly away.

title: Psalms 90:11
content: 11 Who knows the intensity of your anger, and your wrath that is equal to the fear of you?

title: Psalms 90:12
content: 12 So teach us to consider our life so that we might live wisely.

title: Psalms 90:13
content: 13 Turn back, Yahweh! How long will it be? Have pity on your servants.

title: Psalms 90:14
content: 14 Satisfy us in the morning with your covenant faithfulness so that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

title: Psalms 90:15
content: 15 Make us glad in proportion to the days you afflicted us and to the years we have experienced trouble.

title: Psalms 90:16
content: 16 Let your servants see your work, and let our children see your majesty.

title: Psalms 90:17
content: 17 May the favor of the Lord our God be ours; prosper the work of our hands; indeed, prosper the work of our hands.

title: Psalms 91:1
content: 1 He who lives in the shelter of the Most High will stay in the shadow of the Almighty.

title: Psalms 91:2
content: 2 I will say of Yahweh, “He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.”

title: Psalms 91:3
content: 3 For he will rescue you from the snare of the hunter and from the deadly plague.

title: Psalms 91:4
content: 4 He will cover you with his wings, and under his wings you will find refuge. His trustworthiness is a shield and protection.

title: Psalms 91:5
content: 5 You will not be afraid of terror in the night, or of the arrow that flies by day,

title: Psalms 91:6
content: 6 or of the plague that roams around in the darkness, or of the disease that comes at noontime.

title: Psalms 91:7
content: 7 A thousand may fall at your side and ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not reach you.

title: Psalms 91:8
content: 8 You will only observe and see the punishment of the wicked.

title: Psalms 91:9
content: 9 For Yahweh is my refuge! Make the Most High your refuge also.

title: Psalms 91:10
content: 10 No evil will overtake you; no affliction will come near your home.

title: Psalms 91:11
content: 11 For he will direct his angels to protect you, to guard you in all your ways.

title: Psalms 91:12
content: 12 They will lift you up with their hand so that you will not hit your foot on a stone.

title: Psalms 91:13
content: 13 You will crush lions and adders under your feet; you will trample on young lions and serpents.

title: Psalms 91:14
content: 14 Because he is devoted to me, I will rescue him. I will protect him because he is loyal to me.

title: Psalms 91:15
content: 15 When he calls to me, I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble; I will give him victory and will honor him.

title: Psalms 91:16
content: 16 I will satisfy him with the length of his days, and show him my salvation.

title: Psalms 92:1
content: 1 A psalm, a song for the Sabbath day. It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh and to sing praises to your name, Most High,

title: Psalms 92:2
content: 2 to proclaim your covenant faithfulness in the morning and your truthfulness every night,

title: Psalms 92:3
content: 3 with a harp of ten strings and with the melody of the lyre.

title: Psalms 92:4
content: 4 For you, Yahweh, have made me glad through your deeds. I will sing for joy because of the deeds of your hands.

title: Psalms 92:5
content: 5 How great are your deeds, Yahweh! Your thoughts are very deep.

title: Psalms 92:6
content: 6 A brutish person does not know, nor does a fool understand this:

title: Psalms 92:7
content: 7 When the wicked sprout like the grass, and even when all the evildoers thrive, still they are doomed to eternal destruction.

title: Psalms 92:8
content: 8 But you, Yahweh, will reign forever.

title: Psalms 92:9
content: 9 Indeed, look at your enemies, Yahweh! Indeed, look at your enemies. They will perish! All those who do evil will be scattered.

title: Psalms 92:10
content: 10 You have lifted up my horn like the horn of the wild ox; I am anointed with fresh oil.

title: Psalms 92:11
content: 11 My eyes have seen the downfall of my enemies; my ears have heard of the doom of my evil foes.

title: Psalms 92:12
content: 12 The righteous will flourish like the palm tree; they will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

title: Psalms 92:13
content: 13 They are planted in the house of Yahweh; they flourish in the courts of our God.

title: Psalms 92:14
content: 14 They bear fruit even when they are old; they stay fresh and green,

title: Psalms 92:15
content: 15 to proclaim that Yahweh is just. He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

title: Psalms 93:1
content: 1 Yahweh reigns; he is robed in majesty; Yahweh has clothed and girded himself with strength. The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.

title: Psalms 93:2
content: 2 Your throne is established from ancient times; you are from everlasting.

title: Psalms 93:3
content: 3 The oceans rise, Yahweh; they have lifted up their voice; the oceans’ waves crash and roar.

title: Psalms 93:4
content: 4 Above the crashing of many waves, the mighty breakers of the sea, Yahweh on high is mighty.

title: Psalms 93:5
content: 5 Your solemn commands are very trustworthy; holiness adorns your house, Yahweh, for the length of your days.

title: Psalms 94:1
content: 1 Yahweh, God who avenges, God who avenges, shine over us.

title: Psalms 94:2
content: 2 Rise up, judge of the earth, give to the proud what they deserve.

title: Psalms 94:3
content: 3 How long will the wicked, Yahweh, how long will the wicked rejoice?

title: Psalms 94:4
content: 4 They pour out their arrogant words; all those who do evil boast.

title: Psalms 94:5
content: 5 They crush your people, Yahweh; they afflict the nation that belongs to you.

title: Psalms 94:6
content: 6 They kill the widow and foreigner who lives in their country, and they murder the fatherless.

title: Psalms 94:7
content: 7 They say, “Yahweh will not see, the God of Jacob does not take notice of it.”

title: Psalms 94:8
content: 8 Understand, you stupid people! You fools, when will you ever learn?

title: Psalms 94:9
content: 9 He who made the ear, does he not hear? He who formed the eye, does he not see?

title: Psalms 94:10
content: 10 He who disciplines the nations, does he not correct? He is the one who gives knowledge to man.

title: Psalms 94:11
content: 11 Yahweh knows the thoughts of men, that they are vapor.

title: Psalms 94:12
content: 12 Blessed is the one whom you instruct, Yahweh, the one whom you teach from your law.

title: Psalms 94:13
content: 13 You give him rest in times of trouble until a pit is dug for the wicked.

title: Psalms 94:14
content: 14 For Yahweh will not forsake his people or abandon his inheritance.

title: Psalms 94:15
content: 15 For judgment will again be righteous; and all the upright in heart will follow it.

title: Psalms 94:16
content: 16 Who will rise up to defend me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the wicked?

title: Psalms 94:17
content: 17 Unless Yahweh had been my help, I would soon be lying down in the place of silence.

title: Psalms 94:18
content: 18 When I said, “My foot is slipping,” Your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, held me up.

title: Psalms 94:19
content: 19 When cares within me are many, your consolations make me happy.

title: Psalms 94:20
content: 20 Can a throne of destruction be allied with you, one who creates injustice by statute?

title: Psalms 94:21
content: 21 They conspire together to take the life of the righteous and they condemn the innocent to death.

title: Psalms 94:22
content: 22 But Yahweh has been my high tower, and my God has been the rock of my refuge.

title: Psalms 94:23
content: 23 He will bring on them their own iniquity and will cut them off in their own wickedness. Yahweh our God will cut them off.

title: Psalms 95:1
content: 1 Oh come, let us sing to Yahweh; let us sing joyfully to the rock of our salvation.

title: Psalms 95:2
content: 2 Let us enter his presence with thanksgiving; let us sing to him with psalms of praise.

title: Psalms 95:3
content: 3 For Yahweh is a great God and a great King superior to all gods.

title: Psalms 95:4
content: 4 In his hand are the depths of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his.

title: Psalms 95:5
content: 5 The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.

title: Psalms 95:6
content: 6 Oh come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Yahweh, our Creator:

title: Psalms 95:7
content: 7 For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Today—oh, that you would hear his voice!

title: Psalms 95:8
content: 8 “Do not harden your heart, as at Meribah, or as on the day of Massah in the wilderness,

title: Psalms 95:9
content: 9 where your forefathers tested me and tried me, though they had seen my deeds.

title: Psalms 95:10
content: 10 For forty years I was angry with that generation and said, ‘This is a people whose hearts wander astray; they have not known my ways.’

title: Psalms 95:11
content: 11 Therefore I vowed in my anger that they would never enter into my resting place.”

title: Psalms 96:1
content: 1 Oh, sing to Yahweh a new song; sing to Yahweh, all the earth.

title: Psalms 96:2
content: 2 Sing to Yahweh, bless his name; announce his salvation day after day.

title: Psalms 96:3
content: 3 Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all the nations.

title: Psalms 96:4
content: 4 For Yahweh is great and is to be praised greatly. He is to be feared above all other gods.

title: Psalms 96:5
content: 5 For all the gods of the nations are idols, but it is Yahweh who made the heavens.

title: Psalms 96:6
content: 6 Splendor and majesty are in his presence. Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

title: Psalms 96:7
content: 7 Ascribe to Yahweh, you clans of peoples, ascribe praise to Yahweh for his glory and strength.

title: Psalms 96:8
content: 8 Give to Yahweh the glory that his name deserves. Bring an offering and come into his courts.

title: Psalms 96:9
content: 9 Bow down to Yahweh in the splendor of holiness; tremble before him, all the earth.

title: Psalms 96:10
content: 10 Say among the nations, “Yahweh reigns.” The world also is established; it cannot be shaken. He judges the peoples fairly.

title: Psalms 96:11
content: 11 Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; let the sea roar and that which fills it shout with joy.

title: Psalms 96:12
content: 12 Let the fields rejoice and all that is in them. Then let all the trees in the forest shout for joy

title: Psalms 96:13
content: 13 before Yahweh, for he is coming. He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his faithfulness.

title: Psalms 97:1
content: 1 Yahweh reigns; let the earth rejoice; let the many coastlands be glad.

title: Psalms 97:2
content: 2 Clouds and darkness surround him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

title: Psalms 97:3
content: 3 Fire goes before him and consumes his adversaries on every side.

title: Psalms 97:4
content: 4 His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.

title: Psalms 97:5
content: 5 The mountains melt like wax before Yahweh, the Lord of the whole earth.

title: Psalms 97:6
content: 6 The skies declare his justice, and all the nations see his glory.

title: Psalms 97:7
content: 7 All those who worship carved figures will be shamed, those who boast in worthless idols— bow down to him, all you gods!

title: Psalms 97:8
content: 8 Zion heard and was glad, and the towns of Judah rejoiced because of your righteous decrees, Yahweh.

title: Psalms 97:9
content: 9 For you, Yahweh, are most high above all the earth. You are exalted far above all gods.

title: Psalms 97:10
content: 10 You who love Yahweh, hate evil! He protects the lives of his faithful ones, and he takes them out of the hand of the wicked.

title: Psalms 97:11
content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous and gladness for those with honest hearts.

title: Psalms 97:12
content: 12 Be glad in Yahweh, you righteous; and give thanks when you remember his holiness.

title: Psalms 98:1
content: 1 A psalm. Oh, sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done marvelous things; his right hand and his holy arm have given him victory.

title: Psalms 98:2
content: 2 Yahweh has made known his salvation; he has openly showed his justice to all the nations.

title: Psalms 98:3
content: 3 He calls to mind his covenant loyalty and faithfulness for the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth will see the victory of our God.

title: Psalms 98:4
content: 4 Shout for joy to Yahweh, all the earth; burst into song, sing for joy, and sing praises.

title: Psalms 98:5
content: 5 Sing praises to Yahweh with the harp, with the harp and melodious song.

title: Psalms 98:6
content: 6 With trumpets and the sound of the horn, make a joyful noise before the King, Yahweh.

title: Psalms 98:7
content: 7 Let the sea shout and everything in it, the world and those who live in it!

title: Psalms 98:8
content: 8 Let the rivers clap their hands, and let the mountains shout for joy.

title: Psalms 98:9
content: 9 Yahweh is coming to judge the earth; he will judge the world with righteousness and the nations with fairness.

title: Psalms 99:1
content: 1 Yahweh reigns; let the nations tremble. He sits enthroned above the cherubim; the earth quakes.

title: Psalms 99:2
content: 2 Yahweh is great in Zion; he is exalted above all the nations.

title: Psalms 99:3
content: 3 Let them praise your great and awesome name; he is holy.

title: Psalms 99:4
content: 4 The king is strong, and he loves justice. You have established fairness; you have done righteousness and justice in Jacob.

title: Psalms 99:5
content: 5 Praise Yahweh our God and worship at his footstool. He is holy.

title: Psalms 99:6
content: 6 Moses and Aaron were among his priests, and Samuel was among those who called on his name. They called to Yahweh, and he answered them.

title: Psalms 99:7
content: 7 He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud. They kept his solemn commands and the statutes that he gave them.

title: Psalms 99:8
content: 8 You answered them, Yahweh our God. A forgiving God you were to them, but one who punished their sinful deeds.

title: Psalms 99:9
content: 9 Praise Yahweh our God, and worship at his holy hill, for Yahweh our God is holy.

title: Psalms 100:1
content: 1 A psalm of thanksgiving. Shout joyfully to Yahweh, all the earth.

title: Psalms 100:2
content: 2 Serve Yahweh with gladness; come before his presence with joyful singing.

title: Psalms 100:3
content: 3 Know that Yahweh is God; he made us, and we are his. We are his people and the sheep of his pasture.

title: Psalms 100:4
content: 4 Enter into his gates with thanksgiving and into his courts with praise. Give thanks to him and bless his name.

title: Psalms 100:5
content: 5 For Yahweh is good; his covenant faithfulness endures forever and his truthfulness through all generations.

title: Psalms 101:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. A Psalm of David I will sing of covenant faithfulness and justice; to you, Yahweh, I will sing praises.

title: Psalms 101:2
content: 2 I will walk in the way of integrity. Oh, when will you come to me? I will walk with integrity within my house.

title: Psalms 101:3
content: 3 I will not put wrongdoing before my eyes; I hate worthless evil; it will not cling to me.

title: Psalms 101:4
content: 4 Perverse people will leave me; I am not loyal to evil.

title: Psalms 101:5
content: 5 I will destroy whoever secretly slanders his neighbor. I will not tolerate anyone who has a proud demeanor and an arrogant attitude.

title: Psalms 101:6
content: 6 I will look to the faithful of the land to sit at my side. Those who walk in the way of integrity may serve me.

title: Psalms 101:7
content: 7 Deceitful people will not remain within my house; liars will not be welcome before my eyes.

title: Psalms 101:8
content: 8 Morning by morning I will destroy all the wicked from the land; I will remove all evildoers from the city of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 102:1
content: 1 A prayer of the afflicted when he is faint and pours out his lament before Yahweh. Hear my prayer, Yahweh; let my cry come near to you.

title: Psalms 102:2
content: 2 Do not hide your face from me in my time of trouble. Listen to me. When I call out to you, answer me quickly.

title: Psalms 102:3
content: 3 For my days pass away like smoke, and my bones burn like fire.

title: Psalms 102:4
content: 4 My heart is crushed, and I am like grass that has withered. I forget to eat any food.

title: Psalms 102:5
content: 5 With my continual groaning, I have become very thin.

title: Psalms 102:6
content: 6 I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I have become like an owl in the ruins.

title: Psalms 102:7
content: 7 I lie awake like a solitary bird, alone on the housetop.

title: Psalms 102:8
content: 8 My enemies taunt me all day long; those who mock me use my name in curses.

title: Psalms 102:9
content: 9 I eat ashes like bread and mix my drink with tears.

title: Psalms 102:10
content: 10 Because of your raging anger, you have lifted me up to throw me down.

title: Psalms 102:11
content: 11 My days are like a shadow that fades, and I have withered like grass.

title: Psalms 102:12
content: 12 But you, Yahweh, live forever, and your fame is for all generations.

title: Psalms 102:13
content: 13 You will rise up and have mercy on Zion. Now is the time to have mercy upon her; the appointed time has come.

title: Psalms 102:14
content: 14 For your servants hold her stones dear and feel compassion for the dust of her ruins.

title: Psalms 102:15
content: 15 The nations will respect your name, Yahweh, and all the kings of the earth will honor your glory.

title: Psalms 102:16
content: 16 Yahweh will rebuild Zion and will appear in his glory.

title: Psalms 102:17
content: 17 At that time, he will respond to the prayer of the destitute; he will not reject their prayer.

title: Psalms 102:18
content: 18 This will be written for future generations, and a people not yet born will praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 102:19
content: 19 For he has looked down from the holy heights; from heaven Yahweh has viewed the earth,

title: Psalms 102:20
content: 20 to hear the groaning of the prisoners, to release those who were condemned to death.

title: Psalms 102:21
content: 21 Then men will proclaim the name of Yahweh in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem

title: Psalms 102:22
content: 22 when the peoples and kingdoms gather together to serve Yahweh.

title: Psalms 102:23
content: 23 He has taken away my strength in the middle of life. He has shortened my days.

title: Psalms 102:24
content: 24 I said, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of life; you are here throughout all generations.

title: Psalms 102:25
content: 25 In ancient times you set the earth in place; the heavens are the work of your hands.

title: Psalms 102:26
content: 26 They will perish, but you will remain; they will all grow old like a garment; like clothing, you will remove them, and they will disappear.

title: Psalms 102:27
content: 27 But you are the same, and your years will have no end.

title: Psalms 102:28
content: 28 The children of your servants will live on, and their descendants will live in your presence.”

title: Psalms 103:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. Of David Bless Yahweh, my inner being! and all that is within me, bless his holy name.

title: Psalms 103:2
content: 2 Bless Yahweh, my soul! and do not forget all of his rewards.

title: Psalms 103:3
content: 3 He pardons all your sins; he heals all your diseases.

title: Psalms 103:4
content: 4 He redeems your life from destruction; he crowns you with steadfastness and mercy.

title: Psalms 103:5
content: 5 He satisfies you with good things; your youth is renewed like the eagle.

title: Psalms 103:6
content: 6 Yahweh does what is right and what is just for all the oppressed.

title: Psalms 103:7
content: 7 He made known his ways to Moses, his deeds to the children of Israel.

title: Psalms 103:8
content: 8 Yahweh is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and abounding in steadfast love.

title: Psalms 103:9
content: 9 He will not always discipline, and he will not keep his anger forever.

title: Psalms 103:10
content: 10 He does not deal with us according to our sins, and he does not treat us according to our iniquities.

title: Psalms 103:11
content: 11 For as the skies are high above the earth, so great is his steadfast love toward those who fear him.

title: Psalms 103:12
content: 12 As far as the east is from the west, this is how far he has removed our transgressions from us.

title: Psalms 103:13
content: 13 As a father has compassion on his children, so Yahweh has compassion on those who fear him.

title: Psalms 103:14
content: 14 For he knows our form; remembering that we are dust.

title: Psalms 103:15
content: 15 As for man, his days are like grass; like the flower of the field he flourishes so.

title: Psalms 103:16
content: 16 For the wind blows over it, and it is no more, and its place does not acknowledge it again.

title: Psalms 103:17
content: 17 But the covenant faithfulness of Yahweh is from everlasting to everlasting on those who honor him, and His righteousness is to their children's children.

title: Psalms 103:18
content: 18 To the ones who keep his covenant, and to the ones who remember his precepts in order to do them.

title: Psalms 103:19
content: 19 Yahweh has established his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom rules over all.

title: Psalms 103:20
content: 20 Bless Yahweh, you his angels, you mighty warriors who do his word, obeying the voice of his word.

title: Psalms 103:21
content: 21 Bless Yahweh, all his hosts, his ministers who do his pleasure.

title: Psalms 103:22
content: 22 Bless Yahweh, all his works, in all the places where he reigns. Bless Yahweh, my inner being!

title: Psalms 104:1
content: 1 I give praise to Yahweh with all my life, Yahweh my God, you are very magnificent; you are clothed with splendor and majesty.

title: Psalms 104:2
content: 2 You cover yourself with light as with a garment; you spread out the heavens like a tent curtain.

title: Psalms 104:3
content: 3 You lay the beams of your chambers on the clouds; you make the clouds your chariot; you walk on the wings of the wind.

title: Psalms 104:4
content: 4 He makes the winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants.

title: Psalms 104:5
content: 5 He laid the foundations of the earth, and it will never be moved.

title: Psalms 104:6
content: 6 You covered the earth with water like a garment; the water covered the mountains.

title: Psalms 104:7
content: 7 Your rebuke made the waters recede; at the sound of your thunderous voice they fled.

title: Psalms 104:8
content: 8 The mountains rose, and the valleys spread out into the places that you had appointed for them.

title: Psalms 104:9
content: 9 You have set a boundary for them that they will not cross; they will not cover the earth again.

title: Psalms 104:10
content: 10 He made springs flow into the valleys; the streams flow between the mountains.

title: Psalms 104:11
content: 11 They supply water for all the animals of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

title: Psalms 104:12
content: 12 By the heavens the birds build their nests; they sing among the branches.

title: Psalms 104:13
content: 13 He waters the mountains from his water chambers in the sky. The earth is filled with the fruit of his labor.

title: Psalms 104:14
content: 14 He makes the grass grow for the cattle and plants for man to cultivate so that man may produce food from the earth.

title: Psalms 104:15
content: 15 He makes wine to make man happy, oil to make his face shine, and food to sustain his life.

title: Psalms 104:16
content: 16 The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain; the cedars of Lebanon which he planted.

title: Psalms 104:17
content: 17 There the birds make their nests. The stork makes the cypress tree her home.

title: Psalms 104:18
content: 18 The wild goats live on the high mountains; the mountain heights are a refuge for the hyraxes.

title: Psalms 104:19
content: 19 He appointed the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows its time for setting.

title: Psalms 104:20
content: 20 You make the darkness of the night when all the beasts of the forest come out.

title: Psalms 104:21
content: 21 The young lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.

title: Psalms 104:22
content: 22 When the sun rises, they retreat and sleep in their dens.

title: Psalms 104:23
content: 23 Meanwhile, people go out to their work and labor away until the evening.

title: Psalms 104:24
content: 24 Yahweh, how many and varied are your works! With wisdom you made them all; the earth overflows with your works.

title: Psalms 104:25
content: 25 Over there is the sea, deep and wide, teeming with innumerable creatures, both small and great.

title: Psalms 104:26
content: 26 The ships travel there, and Leviathan is also there, which you formed to play in the sea.

title: Psalms 104:27
content: 27 All these look to you to give them their food on time.

title: Psalms 104:28
content: 28 When you give to them, they gather; when you open your hand, they are satisfied.

title: Psalms 104:29
content: 29 When you hide your face, they are troubled; if you take away their breath, they die and return to dust.

title: Psalms 104:30
content: 30 When you send out your Spirit, they are created, and you renew the countryside.

title: Psalms 104:31
content: 31 May the glory of Yahweh last forever; may Yahweh enjoy his creation.

title: Psalms 104:32
content: 32 He looks down on the earth, and it shakes; he touches the mountains, and they smoke.

title: Psalms 104:33
content: 33 I will sing to Yahweh all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.

title: Psalms 104:34
content: 34 May my thoughts be sweet to him; I will rejoice in Yahweh.

title: Psalms 104:35
content: 35 May sinners vanish from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. I give praise to Yahweh with all my life. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 105:1
content: 1 Give thanks to Yahweh, call on his name; make known his deeds among the nations.

title: Psalms 105:2
content: 2 Sing to him, sing praises to him; speak of all his marvelous deeds.

title: Psalms 105:3
content: 3 Boast in his holy name; let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.

title: Psalms 105:4
content: 4 Seek Yahweh and his strength; seek his presence continually.

title: Psalms 105:5
content: 5 Recall the marvelous things he has done, his miracles and the decrees from his mouth,

title: Psalms 105:6
content: 6 you descendants of Abraham his servant, you people of Jacob, his chosen ones.

title: Psalms 105:7
content: 7 He is Yahweh, our God. His decrees are on all the earth.

title: Psalms 105:8
content: 8 He keeps in mind his covenant forever, the word that he commanded for a thousand generations.

title: Psalms 105:9
content: 9 He calls to mind the covenant that he made with Abraham and his oath to Isaac.

title: Psalms 105:10
content: 10 This is what he confirmed to Jacob as a statute and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.

title: Psalms 105:11
content: 11 He said, “I will give you the land of Canaan as your share of your inheritance.”

title: Psalms 105:12
content: 12 He said this when they were only few in number, so very few, and were strangers in the land.

title: Psalms 105:13
content: 13 They went from nation to nation and from one kingdom to another.

title: Psalms 105:14
content: 14 He did not allow anyone to oppress them; he rebuked kings for their sakes.

title: Psalms 105:15
content: 15 He said, “Do not touch my anointed ones, and do not harm my prophets.”

title: Psalms 105:16
content: 16 He called for a famine on the land; he cut off the whole supply of bread.

title: Psalms 105:17
content: 17 He sent a man ahead of them; Joseph was sold as a servant.

title: Psalms 105:18
content: 18 His feet were bound by shackles; on his neck was put an iron collar,

title: Psalms 105:19
content: 19 until what he had said came to pass. The word of Yahweh tested him.

title: Psalms 105:20
content: 20 The king sent servants to release him; the ruler of the people set him free.

title: Psalms 105:21
content: 21 He put him in charge of his house as ruler of all his possessions

title: Psalms 105:22
content: 22 to instruct his princes as he wished and to teach his elders wisdom.

title: Psalms 105:23
content: 23 Then Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham.

title: Psalms 105:24
content: 24 Yahweh made his people fruitful, and made them stronger greatly than their enemies.

title: Psalms 105:25
content: 25 He caused their enemies to hate his people, to mistreat his servants.

title: Psalms 105:26
content: 26 He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.

title: Psalms 105:27
content: 27 They performed his signs among the Egyptians, his wonders in the land of Ham.

title: Psalms 105:28
content: 28 He sent darkness and made that land dark, but its people did not obey his commands.

title: Psalms 105:29
content: 29 He turned their water into blood and killed their fish.

title: Psalms 105:30
content: 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, even in the rooms of their rulers.

title: Psalms 105:31
content: 31 He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats came throughout their country.

title: Psalms 105:32
content: 32 He turned their rain into hail, with fire flaming on their land.

title: Psalms 105:33
content: 33 He destroyed their vines and fig trees; he broke the trees of their country.

title: Psalms 105:34
content: 34 He spoke, and the locusts came, young locusts, without number.

title: Psalms 105:35
content: 35 The locusts ate up all of the vegetation in their land; They ate up all the crops of the ground.

title: Psalms 105:36
content: 36 He killed every firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their strength.

title: Psalms 105:37
content: 37 He brought the Israelites out with silver and gold; none of his tribes stumbled on the way.

title: Psalms 105:38
content: 38 Egypt was glad when they went away, for the fear of them had fallen upon them.

title: Psalms 105:39
content: 39 He spread a cloud for a covering and made a fire to light up the night.

title: Psalms 105:40
content: 40 The Israelites asked for food, and he brought quail and satisfied them with bread from heaven.

title: Psalms 105:41
content: 41 He split the rock, and waters gushed from it; they flowed in the wilderness like a river.

title: Psalms 105:42
content: 42 For he called to mind his holy promise that he made to Abraham his servant.

title: Psalms 105:43
content: 43 He led his people out with joy, his chosen with shouts of triumph.

title: Psalms 105:44
content: 44 He gave them the lands of the nations; they took possession of the wealth of the peoples

title: Psalms 105:45
content: 45 so that they might keep his statutes and obey his laws. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 106:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 106:2
content: 2 Who can recount the mighty acts of Yahweh or proclaim in full all his praiseworthy deeds?

title: Psalms 106:3
content: 3 Blessed are those who do what is right, and whose deeds are always just.

title: Psalms 106:4
content: 4 Call me to mind, Yahweh, when you show favor to your people; help me when you save them.

title: Psalms 106:5
content: 5 Then I will see the prosperity of your chosen, rejoice in the gladness of your nation, and glory with your inheritance.

title: Psalms 106:6
content: 6 We have sinned like our ancestors; we have done wrong, and we have done evil.

title: Psalms 106:7
content: 7 Our fathers did not appreciate your marvelous deeds in Egypt; they ignored your many acts of covenant faithfulness; they were rebellious at the sea, the Sea of Reeds.

title: Psalms 106:8
content: 8 Nevertheless, he saved them for his name’s sake so that he might reveal his power.

title: Psalms 106:9
content: 9 He rebuked the Sea of Reeds, and it dried up. Then he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.

title: Psalms 106:10
content: 10 He saved them from the hand of those who hated them, and he rescued them from the hand of the enemy.

title: Psalms 106:11
content: 11 But the waters covered their adversaries; not one of them survived.

title: Psalms 106:12
content: 12 Then they believed his words, and they sang his praise.

title: Psalms 106:13
content: 13 But they quickly forgot what he had done; they did not wait for his instructions.

title: Psalms 106:14
content: 14 They had insatiable cravings in the wilderness, and they challenged God in the desert.

title: Psalms 106:15
content: 15 So he gave them what they requested, but he sent a horrible disease upon them.

title: Psalms 106:16
content: 16 In the camp they became jealous of Moses and Aaron, the holy priest of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 106:17
content: 17 The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and covered the followers of Abiram.

title: Psalms 106:18
content: 18 Fire broke out among them; the fire consumed the wicked.

title: Psalms 106:19
content: 19 They made a calf at Horeb and worshiped a cast metal figure.

title: Psalms 106:20
content: 20 They traded the glory of God for the image of a bull that eats grass.

title: Psalms 106:21
content: 21 They forgot God their Savior, who had done great deeds in Egypt.

title: Psalms 106:22
content: 22 He had done wonderful things in the land of Ham and mighty acts at the Sea of Reeds.

title: Psalms 106:23
content: 23 So he said he would destroy them— had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him, to turn away his anger from destroying them.

title: Psalms 106:24
content: 24 Then they despised the fruitful land; they did not believe his promise,

title: Psalms 106:25
content: 25 but grumbled in their tents, and did not obey Yahweh.

title: Psalms 106:26
content: 26 Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them that he would let them die in the desert,

title: Psalms 106:27
content: 27 scatter their descendants among the nations, and scatter them in foreign lands.

title: Psalms 106:28
content: 28 They worshiped the Baal of Peor and ate the sacrifices offered to the dead.

title: Psalms 106:29
content: 29 They provoked him to anger with their actions, and a plague broke out among them.

title: Psalms 106:30
content: 30 Then Phinehas rose to intervene, and the plague subsided.

title: Psalms 106:31
content: 31 It was counted to him as a righteous deed to all generations forever.

title: Psalms 106:32
content: 32 They also angered Yahweh at the waters of Meribah, and Moses suffered because of them.

title: Psalms 106:33
content: 33 They made Moses bitter, and he spoke rashly.

title: Psalms 106:34
content: 34 They did not destroy the nations as Yahweh had commanded them,

title: Psalms 106:35
content: 35 but they mingled with the nations and learned their ways

title: Psalms 106:36
content: 36 and worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.

title: Psalms 106:37
content: 37 They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

title: Psalms 106:38
content: 38 They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, desecrating the land with blood.

title: Psalms 106:39
content: 39 They were defiled by their deeds; in their actions they were like prostitutes.

title: Psalms 106:40
content: 40 So Yahweh was angry with his people, and he despised his own people.

title: Psalms 106:41
content: 41 He gave them into the hand of the nations, and those who hated them ruled over them.

title: Psalms 106:42
content: 42 Their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection to their authority.

title: Psalms 106:43
content: 43 Many times he came to help them, but they kept rebelling and were brought low by their own sin.

title: Psalms 106:44
content: 44 Nevertheless, he paid attention to their distress when he heard their cry for help.

title: Psalms 106:45
content: 45 He called to mind his covenant with them and relented because of his steadfast love.

title: Psalms 106:46
content: 46 He caused all their conquerers to have pity on them.

title: Psalms 106:47
content: 47 Save us, Yahweh, our God. Gather us from among the nations so that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praises.

title: Psalms 106:48
content: 48 May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised from everlasting to everlasting. All the people said, “Amen.” Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 107:1
content: 1 Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, and his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 107:2
content: 2 Let the redeemed of Yahweh speak out, those he has rescued from the hand of the enemy.

title: Psalms 107:3
content: 3 He has gathered them out of foreign lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.

title: Psalms 107:4
content: 4 They wandered in the wilderness on a desert road and found no city in which to live.

title: Psalms 107:5
content: 5 Because they were hungry and thirsty, they fainted from exhaustion.

title: Psalms 107:6
content: 6 Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he rescued them out of their distress.

title: Psalms 107:7
content: 7 He led them by a direct path so that they would go to a city to live in.

title: Psalms 107:8
content: 8 Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!

title: Psalms 107:9
content: 9 For he satisfies the longings of those who are thirsty, and the desires of those who are hungry he fills up with good things.

title: Psalms 107:10
content: 10 Some sat in darkness and in gloom, prisoners in affliction and chains.

title: Psalms 107:11
content: 11 This was because they had rebelled against God’s word and rejected the instruction of the Most High.

title: Psalms 107:12
content: 12 He humbled their hearts through hardship; they stumbled and there was no one to help them up.

title: Psalms 107:13
content: 13 Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.

title: Psalms 107:14
content: 14 He brought them out of darkness and gloom and broke their bonds.

title: Psalms 107:15
content: 15 Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!

title: Psalms 107:16
content: 16 For he has broken the gates of bronze and cut through the bars of iron.

title: Psalms 107:17
content: 17 They were foolish in their rebellious ways and afflicted because of their sins.

title: Psalms 107:18
content: 18 They lost their desire to eat any food, and they came close to the gates of death.

title: Psalms 107:19
content: 19 Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.

title: Psalms 107:20
content: 20 He sent his word and healed them, and he rescued them from their destruction.

title: Psalms 107:21
content: 21 Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!

title: Psalms 107:22
content: 22 Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving and proclaim his deeds in singing.

title: Psalms 107:23
content: 23 Some travel on the sea in ships and do business overseas.

title: Psalms 107:24
content: 24 These saw the deeds of Yahweh and his wonders on the seas.

title: Psalms 107:25
content: 25 For he commanded and aroused the windstorm that stirs up the seas.

title: Psalms 107:26
content: 26 They reached up to the sky; they went down to the depths. Their lives melted away in distress.

title: Psalms 107:27
content: 27 They swayed and staggered like drunkards and were at their wits’ end.

title: Psalms 107:28
content: 28 Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.

title: Psalms 107:29
content: 29 He calmed the storm, and the waves were stilled.

title: Psalms 107:30
content: 30 Then they rejoiced because they are quiet, so he brought them to their desired harbor.

title: Psalms 107:31
content: 31 Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!

title: Psalms 107:32
content: 32 Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.

title: Psalms 107:33
content: 33 He turns rivers into a wilderness, springs of water into dry land,

title: Psalms 107:34
content: 34 and a fruitful land into a barren place because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.

title: Psalms 107:35
content: 35 He turns the wilderness into a pool of water and dry land into springs of water.

title: Psalms 107:36
content: 36 He settles the hungry there, and they build a city to live in.

title: Psalms 107:37
content: 37 They sow fields and plant vineyards, that they may bring in a fruitful harvest.

title: Psalms 107:38
content: 38 He blesses them so they are very numerous. He does not let their cattle decrease in number.

title: Psalms 107:39
content: 39 They were diminished and brought low by painful distress and suffering.

title: Psalms 107:40
content: 40 He pours contempt on the leaders and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there are no roads.

title: Psalms 107:41
content: 41 But he protects the needy from affliction and cares for his families like a flock.

title: Psalms 107:42
content: 42 The upright will see this and rejoice, and all wickedness shuts its mouth.

title: Psalms 107:43
content: 43 Whoever is wise should take note of these things and meditate on Yahweh’s acts of covenant faithfulness.

title: Psalms 108:1
content: 1 A song, a psalm of David. My heart is fixed, God; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises also with my honored heart.

title: Psalms 108:2
content: 2 Wake up, lute and harp; I will wake up the dawn.

title: Psalms 108:3
content: 3 I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the peoples; I will sing praises to you among the nations.

title: Psalms 108:4
content: 4 For your covenant faithfulness is great above the heavens; and your trustworthiness reaches to the skies.

title: Psalms 108:5
content: 5 Be exalted, God, above the heavens, and may your glory be exalted over all the earth.

title: Psalms 108:6
content: 6 So that those you love may be rescued, rescue us with your right hand and answer me.

title: Psalms 108:7
content: 7 God has spoken in his holiness; “I will rejoice; I will divide Shechem and apportion out the Valley of Succoth.

title: Psalms 108:8
content: 8 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.

title: Psalms 108:9
content: 9 Moab is my washbasin; over Edom I will throw my shoe; I will shout in triumph because of Philistia.

title: Psalms 108:10
content: 10 Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me to Edom?”

title: Psalms 108:11
content: 11 God, have you not rejected us? You do not go into battle with our army.

title: Psalms 108:12
content: 12 Give us help against the enemy, for man’s help is futile.

title: Psalms 108:13
content: 13 We will triumph with God’s help; he will trample down our enemies.

title: Psalms 109:1
content: 1 For the chief musician. A psalm of David. To the chief musician. A Psalm of David. God whom I praise, do not be silent,

title: Psalms 109:2
content: 2 For the wicked and deceitful attack me; they speak lies against me.

title: Psalms 109:3
content: 3 They surround me and say hateful things, and they attack me without cause.

title: Psalms 109:4
content: 4 In return for my love they accuse me, but I pray for them.

title: Psalms 109:5
content: 5 They repay me evil for good, and they hate my love.

title: Psalms 109:6
content: 6 Appoint a wicked man over such an enemy as these people; appoint an accuser to stand at his right hand.

title: Psalms 109:7
content: 7 When he is judged, may he be found guilty; may his prayer be considered sinful.

title: Psalms 109:8
content: 8 May his days be few; may another take his office.

title: Psalms 109:9
content: 9 May his children be fatherless, and may his wife be a widow.

title: Psalms 109:10
content: 10 May his children wander about and beg, asking for handouts as they leave their ruined home.

title: Psalms 109:11
content: 11 May the creditor take all he owns; may strangers plunder what he earns.

title: Psalms 109:12
content: 12 May no one extend any kindness to him; may no one have pity on his fatherless children.

title: Psalms 109:13
content: 13 May his children be cut off; may their name be blotted out in the next generation.

title: Psalms 109:14
content: 14 May his ancestors’ sins be mentioned to Yahweh; and may the sin of his mother not be forgotten.

title: Psalms 109:15
content: 15 May their guilt always be before Yahweh; may Yahweh cut off their memory from the earth.

title: Psalms 109:16
content: 16 May Yahweh do this because this man never bothered to show any covenant faithfulness, but instead harassed the oppressed, the needy, and the disheartened to death.

title: Psalms 109:17
content: 17 He loved cursing; may it come back upon him. He had no desire for blessing; may no blessing come to him.

title: Psalms 109:18
content: 18 He clothed himself with cursing as his garment, and his curse came into his inner being like water, like oil into his bones.

title: Psalms 109:19
content: 19 May his curses be to him like the clothes he wears to cover himself, like the belt he always wears.

title: Psalms 109:20
content: 20 May this be the reward of my accusers from Yahweh, of those who say evil things about me.

title: Psalms 109:21
content: 21 Yahweh my Lord, deal kindly with me for your name’s sake. Because your covenant faithfulness is good, save me.

title: Psalms 109:22
content: 22 For I am oppressed and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

title: Psalms 109:23
content: 23 I am fading away like the shadow of the evening; I am shaken off like a locust.

title: Psalms 109:24
content: 24 My knees are weak from fasting; My flesh is feeble from lack of fatness.

title: Psalms 109:25
content: 25 I am disdained by my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.

title: Psalms 109:26
content: 26 Help me, Yahweh my God; save me by your covenant faithfulness.

title: Psalms 109:27
content: 27 May they know that this is your hand, that you, Yahweh, have done this.

title: Psalms 109:28
content: 28 Though they curse me, please bless me; when they attack, may they be put to shame, but may your servant rejoice.

title: Psalms 109:29
content: 29 May my adversaries be clothed with shame; may they wear their shame like a robe.

title: Psalms 109:30
content: 30 With my mouth I give great thanks to Yahweh; I will praise him in the midst of a crowd.

title: Psalms 109:31
content: 31 For he will stand at the right hand of the one who is needy, to save him from those who judge him.

title: Psalms 110:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. Of David, a song. The declaration of Yahweh to my lord, “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”

title: Psalms 110:2
content: 2 Yahweh will stretch out the scepter of your strength from Zion; rule in the midst of your enemies.

title: Psalms 110:3
content: 3 Your people voluntarily follow in holy splendor in the day of your strength; from the womb of the dawn your youth will be to you as dew.

title: Psalms 110:4
content: 4 Yahweh has sworn, and will not change his mind: “You are a priest forever, after the manner of Melchizedek.”

title: Psalms 110:5
content: 5 The Lord is at your right hand. He will crush kings on the day of his anger.

title: Psalms 110:6
content: 6 He will judge the nations; he will fill corpses; he will crush the heads of many lands.

title: Psalms 110:7
content: 7 He will drink from the stream along the path, Therefore, he will lift up the head.

title: Psalms 111:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart in the assembly of the upright, in their gathering.

title: Psalms 111:2
content: 2 The works of Yahweh are great, eagerly awaited by all those who desire them.

title: Psalms 111:3
content: 3 His work is majestic and glorious, and his righteousness endures forever.

title: Psalms 111:4
content: 4 He does wonderful things that will be remembered; Yahweh is gracious and merciful.

title: Psalms 111:5
content: 5 He gives food to his faithful followers. He will always call to mind his covenant.

title: Psalms 111:6
content: 6 He showed his powerful works to his people in giving them the inheritance of the nations.

title: Psalms 111:7
content: 7 The works of his hands are trustworthy and just; all his instructions are reliable.

title: Psalms 111:8
content: 8 They are established forever, to be observed faithfully and properly.

title: Psalms 111:9
content: 9 He has sent redemption to his people; he ordained his covenant forever; holy and awesome is his name.

title: Psalms 111:10
content: 10 To honor Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom; those who carry out his instructions have good understanding. His praise endures forever.

title: Psalms 112:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Blessed is the man who fears Yahweh, who greatly delights in his commandments.

title: Psalms 112:2
content: 2 His descendants will be powerful on earth; the descendants of the godly man will be blessed.

title: Psalms 112:3
content: 3 Wealth and riches are in his house; his righteousness will endure forever.

title: Psalms 112:4
content: 4 Light shines in the darkness for the godly person; he is gracious, merciful, and just.

title: Psalms 112:5
content: 5 It goes well for the man who deals graciously and lends money, who conducts his affairs with honesty.

title: Psalms 112:6
content: 6 For he will never be moved; the righteous person will be remembered forever.

title: Psalms 112:7
content: 7 He does not fear bad news; his heart is sure, trusting in Yahweh.

title: Psalms 112:8
content: 8 His heart is tranquil, without fear, until he looks in triumph over his adversaries.

title: Psalms 112:9
content: 9 He generously gives to the poor; his righteousness endures forever; he will be exalted with honor.

title: Psalms 112:10
content: 10 The wicked person will see this and be angry; he will grind his teeth in rage and he will melt away; the desire of the wicked people will perish.

title: Psalms 113:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Praise him, you servants of Yahweh; praise the name of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 113:2
content: 2 Blessed be the name of Yahweh, both now and forevermore.

title: Psalms 113:3
content: 3 From the rising of the sun to its setting, Yahweh’s name should be praised.

title: Psalms 113:4
content: 4 Yahweh is exalted above all nations, and his glory reaches above the skies.

title: Psalms 113:5
content: 5 Who is like Yahweh our God, who has his seat on high,

title: Psalms 113:6
content: 6 who looks down at the sky and at the earth?

title: Psalms 113:7
content: 7 He raises up the poor out of the dirt and lifts up the needy from the ash heap,

title: Psalms 113:8
content: 8 so that he may seat him with princes, with the princes of his people.

title: Psalms 113:9
content: 9 He gives a home to the barren woman of the house, he makes her a joyful mother of children. Praise Yahweh!

title: Psalms 114:1
content: 1 When Israel left Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people who spoke a foreign language,

title: Psalms 114:2
content: 2 Judah became his holy place, Israel his kingdom.

title: Psalms 114:3
content: 3 The sea looked and fled; the Jordan turned back.

title: Psalms 114:4
content: 4 The mountains skipped like rams, the little hills like lambs.

title: Psalms 114:5
content: 5 Why did you flee, sea? Jordan, why did you turn back?

title: Psalms 114:6
content: 6 Mountains, why did you skip like rams? You little hills, why did you skip like lambs?

title: Psalms 114:7
content: 7 Tremble, earth, before the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms 114:8
content: 8 He turned the rock into a pool of water, the hard rock into a spring of water.

title: Psalms 115:1
content: 1 Not to us, Yahweh, not to us, but to your name bring honor, for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness.

title: Psalms 115:2
content: 2 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”

title: Psalms 115:3
content: 3 Our God is in heaven; he does whatever he pleases.

title: Psalms 115:4
content: 4 The nations’ idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

title: Psalms 115:5
content: 5 Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;

title: Psalms 115:6
content: 6 they have ears, but they do not hear; they have noses, but they do not smell.

title: Psalms 115:7
content: 7 Those idols have hands, but do not feel; they have feet, but they cannot walk; nor do they speak from their mouths.

title: Psalms 115:8
content: 8 Those who make them are like them, as is everyone who trusts in them.

title: Psalms 115:9
content: 9 Israel, trust in Yahweh; he is your help and shield.

title: Psalms 115:10
content: 10 House of Aaron, trust in Yahweh; he is your help and shield.

title: Psalms 115:11
content: 11 You who honor Yahweh, trust in him; he is your help and shield.

title: Psalms 115:12
