content: 12 Yahweh takes notice of us and will bless us; he will bless the family of Israel; he will bless the family of Aaron.

title: Psalms 115:13
content: 13 He will bless those who honor him, both young and old.

title: Psalms 115:14
content: 14 May Yahweh increase your numbers more and more, yours and your descendants’.

title: Psalms 115:15
content: 15 May you be blessed by Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 115:16
content: 16 The heavens, even the heavens belong to Yahweh; but the earth he has given to the sons of men.

title: Psalms 115:17
content: 17 The dead do not praise Yahweh, nor do any who go down into silence;

title: Psalms 115:18
content: 18 But we will bless Yahweh now and forevermore. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 116:1
content: 1 I love Yahweh because he hears my voice and my pleas for mercy.

title: Psalms 116:2
content: 2 Because he listened to me, I will call on him as long as I live.

title: Psalms 116:3
content: 3 The cords of death surrounded me, and the snares of Sheol confronted me; I felt anguish and sorrow.

title: Psalms 116:4
content: 4 Then I called on the name of Yahweh: “Please Yahweh, rescue my life.”

title: Psalms 116:5
content: 5 Yahweh is merciful and fair; our God is compassionate.

title: Psalms 116:6
content: 6 Yahweh protects the naive; I was brought low, and he saved me.

title: Psalms 116:7
content: 7 My soul can return to its resting place, for Yahweh has been good to me.

title: Psalms 116:8
content: 8 For you rescued my life from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.

title: Psalms 116:9
content: 9 I will walk before Yahweh in the land of the living.

title: Psalms 116:10
content: 10 I believed in him, even when I said, “I am greatly afflicted.”

title: Psalms 116:11
content: 11 In my confusion I said, “All men are liars.”

title: Psalms 116:12
content: 12 How can I repay Yahweh for all his kindnesses to me?

title: Psalms 116:13
content: 13 I will raise the cup of salvation, and call on the name of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 116:14
content: 14 I will fulfill my vows to Yahweh now in the presence of all his people.

title: Psalms 116:15
content: 15 Precious in the sight of Yahweh is the death of his faithful ones.

title: Psalms 116:16
content: 16 Yahweh, indeed, I am your servant; I am your servant, the son of your servant woman; you have taken away my bonds.

title: Psalms 116:17
content: 17 I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving and will call on the name of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 116:18
content: 18 I will fulfill my vows to Yahweh now in the presence of all his people,

title: Psalms 116:19
content: 19 in the courts of Yahweh’s house, in your midst, Jerusalem. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 117:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh, all you nations; exalt him, all you peoples.

title: Psalms 117:2
content: 2 For his covenant faithfulness is great toward us, and the trustworthiness of Yahweh endures forever. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 118:1
content: 1 Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 118:2
content: 2 Let Israel now say, “His covenant faithfulness endures forever.”

title: Psalms 118:3
content: 3 Let the house of Aaron now say, “His covenant faithfulness endures forever.”

title: Psalms 118:4
content: 4 Let the loyal followers of Yahweh say, “His covenant faithfulness endures for ever.”

title: Psalms 118:5
content: 5 In my distress I called out to Yahweh; Yahweh answered me and set me free.

title: Psalms 118:6
content: 6 Yahweh is with me; I will not be afraid; what can man do to me?

title: Psalms 118:7
content: 7 Yahweh is on my side as my helper; I will look in triumph on those who hate me.

title: Psalms 118:8
content: 8 It is better to take shelter in Yahweh than to put confidence in man.

title: Psalms 118:9
content: 9 It is better to take refuge in Yahweh than to put one’s trust in a princes.

title: Psalms 118:10
content: 10 All the nations surrounded me; in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.

title: Psalms 118:11
content: 11 They surrounded me; yes, they surrounded me; in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.

title: Psalms 118:12
content: 12 They surrounded me like bees; they disappeared as quickly as fire among thorns; in Yahweh’s name I cut them off.

title: Psalms 118:13
content: 13 They attacked me to knock me down, but Yahweh helped me.

title: Psalms 118:14
content: 14 Yahweh is my strength and song, and he is the one who rescues me.

title: Psalms 118:15
content: 15 The joyful shout of victory is heard in the tents of the righteous; the right hand of Yahweh does valiantly.

title: Psalms 118:16
content: 16 The right hand of Yahweh is exalted; the right hand of Yahweh does valiantly.

title: Psalms 118:17
content: 17 I will not die, but live and declare the deeds of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 118:18
content: 18 Yahweh has punished me harshly; but he has not handed me over to death.

title: Psalms 118:19
content: 19 Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will enter them and I will give thanks to Yahweh.

title: Psalms 118:20
content: 20 This is the gate of Yahweh; the righteous enter through it.

title: Psalms 118:21
content: 21 I will give thanks to you, for you answered me, and you have become my salvation.

title: Psalms 118:22
content: 22 The stone that the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone.

title: Psalms 118:23
content: 23 This is Yahweh’s doing; it is marvelous in our eyes.

title: Psalms 118:24
content: 24 This is the day on which Yahweh has acted; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

title: Psalms 118:25
content: 25 Please, Yahweh, give us victory! Please, Yahweh, send now success!

title: Psalms 118:26
content: 26 Blessed is he who comes in the name of Yahweh; we bless you from the house of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 118:27
content: 27 Yahweh is God, and he has given us light; bind the sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar.

title: Psalms 118:28
content: 28 You are my God, and I will give thanks to you; you are my God; I will exalt you.

title: Psalms 118:29
content: 29 Oh, give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good; for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 119:1
content: 1 Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, who walk in the teaching of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 119:2
content: 2 Blessed are they who keep his testimonies, who seek him with all their heart.

title: Psalms 119:3
content: 3 Surely they do not practice injustice; they walk in his ways.

title: Psalms 119:4
content: 4 You have commanded your instructions so that we should carefully observe them.

title: Psalms 119:5
content: 5 Oh, that my path would be firmly established, keeping your statutes!

title: Psalms 119:6
content: 6 Then I would not be ashamed when I look to all of your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:7
content: 7 I will give thanks to you with an upright heart when I learn the judgments of your righteousness.

title: Psalms 119:8
content: 8 I will keep your statutes; do not utterly leave me.

title: Psalms 119:9
content: 9 How can a young man keep his path pure? By keeping your word.

title: Psalms 119:10
content: 10 With my whole heart I seek you; Do not let me stray from your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:11
content: 11 I have hidden your word in my heart so that I might not sin against you.

title: Psalms 119:12
content: 12 Blessed you are, Yahweh; teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:13
content: 13 With my lips I have announced all the judgments of your mouth.

title: Psalms 119:14
content: 14 I rejoice in the way of your testimonies more than in all riches.

title: Psalms 119:15
content: 15 I will meditate on your instructions and I will consider your paths.

title: Psalms 119:16
content: 16 I delight in your statutes; I will not forget your word.

title: Psalms 119:17
content: 17 Deal kindly with your servant so that I may live and keep your word.

title: Psalms 119:18
content: 18 Uncover my eyes so that I may gaze on the marvelous works from your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:19
content: 19 I am a foreigner in the land; do not hide your commandments from me.

title: Psalms 119:20
content: 20 My inner being is crushed with longing for your judgments at all times.

title: Psalms 119:21
content: 21 You rebuke the proud, who are cursed, who wander from your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:22
content: 22 Spare me from disgrace and humiliation, for I have kept your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:23
content: 23 Even though rulers sit against me and slander, your servant meditates on your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:24
content: 24 Also, your testimonies are my pleasure. They are my counselors.

title: Psalms 119:25
content: 25 My inner being clings to the dust! Give me life according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:26
content: 26 I recounted my ways, and you answered me. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:27
content: 27 Make me understand the way of your instructions, so that I can meditate on your wondrous works.

title: Psalms 119:28
content: 28 My inner being melts away from grief Lift me up by your word.

title: Psalms 119:29
content: 29 Turn from me the path of deceit; graciously give me your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:30
content: 30 I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I have desired your judgments.

title: Psalms 119:31
content: 31 I cling to your testimonies; Yahweh, do not let me be shamed.

title: Psalms 119:32
content: 32 I run in the way of your commandments, for you enlarge my heart.

title: Psalms 119:33
content: 33 Teach me, Yahweh, the way of your statutes, and I will keep it to the end.

title: Psalms 119:34
content: 34 Give me understanding, and I will keep your teaching; I will observe it with all my heart.

title: Psalms 119:35
content: 35 Guide me in the way of your commandments, for I delight in it.

title: Psalms 119:36
content: 36 Incline my heart toward your testimonies and not toward unrighteous gain.

title: Psalms 119:37
content: 37 Turn away my eyes from looking at worthless things; in your ways, revive me.

title: Psalms 119:38
content: 38 Fulfill for your servant your promises. that he may fear you.

title: Psalms 119:39
content: 39 Turn away the reproach that I dread, for your judgments are good.

title: Psalms 119:40
content: 40 Look, I long for your precepts; in your righteousness, revive me.

title: Psalms 119:41
content: 41 May your steadfast love come, oh Yahweh— your salvation, according to your promise;

title: Psalms 119:42
content: 42 then I will answer the one who mocks me with a word, for I trust in your word.

title: Psalms 119:43
content: 43 Do not utterly take the word of truth from my mouth, for I hope in your judgments.

title: Psalms 119:44
content: 44 I will observe your teaching continually, forever and ever.

title: Psalms 119:45
content: 45 I will walk in a broad path, for I seek your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:46
content: 46 I will speak of your testimonies before kings, and I will not be ashamed.

title: Psalms 119:47
content: 47 I delight in your commandments, which I love.

title: Psalms 119:48
content: 48 I will lift up my hands to your commandments, which I love; I will meditate on your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:49
content: 49 Remember your word to your servant because you have given me hope.

title: Psalms 119:50
content: 50 This is my comfort in my affliction: that your promise keeps me alive.

title: Psalms 119:51
content: 51 The proud utterly scoff at me, from your teaching I do not turned aside.

title: Psalms 119:52
content: 52 I remember your judgments from ancient times, Yahweh, and I comfort myself.

title: Psalms 119:53
content: 53 Hot anger has seized me because of the wicked who reject your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:54
content: 54 Your statutes are songs for me in the house where I temporarily live.

title: Psalms 119:55
content: 55 I remember your name during the night, Yahweh, and I observe your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:56
content: 56 This is for me because I keep your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:57
content: 57 Yahweh is my portion; I promise to observe your words.

title: Psalms 119:58
content: 58 I entreat your favor with my whole heart; be merciful to me according to your promises.

title: Psalms 119:59
content: 59 I examine my ways and turn my feet to your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:60
content: 60 I hurry and do not delay to observe your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:61
content: 61 The cords of the wicked ensnare me; I do not forget your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:62
content: 62 In the middle of the night I rise to bring praise to you because of the judgments of your righteousness.

title: Psalms 119:63
content: 63 I am a companion to all who fear you, and observe your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:64
content: 64 The earth is full of your steadfast love, Yahweh; teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:65
content: 65 You do good to your servant, Yahweh, according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:66
content: 66 Teach me good discernment and understanding, for I trust in your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:67
content: 67 Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I observe your promises.

title: Psalms 119:68
content: 68 You are good, and you do good. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:69
content: 69 The arrogant smear me with lies, but I myself keep your precepts with my whole heart.

title: Psalms 119:70
content: 70 Their hearts are unfeeling like fat, but I myself delight in your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:71
content: 71 It is good for me that I have suffered so that I would learn your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:72
content: 72 The teaching of your mouth is good to me, more than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.

title: Psalms 119:73
content: 73 Your hands have made me and fashioned me; give me understanding so that I may learn your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:74
content: 74 May those who fear you see me and rejoice because I hope in your word.

title: Psalms 119:75
content: 75 Yahweh, I know that your judgments are just, and in faithfulness you humble me.

title: Psalms 119:76
content: 76 Let your steadfast love be my comfort, just as your promises to your servant.

title: Psalms 119:77
content: 77 May your grace come to me so that I may live, for your teaching is my delight.

title: Psalms 119:78
content: 78 Let the proud be put to shame, for they have accused me falsely; but as for me, I will meditate on your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:79
content: 79 May those who fear you turn to me, also those who know your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:80
content: 80 May my heart be blameless with respect to your statutes, so that I may not be put to shame.

title: Psalms 119:81
content: 81 My inner being faints with longing for your salvation! I hope for your word.

title: Psalms 119:82
content: 82 My eyes faint with longing for your promise; saying, "When will you comfort me?"

title: Psalms 119:83
content: 83 For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke; I do not forget your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:84
content: 84 How long must your servant endure this; when will you act in pursuit of justice for me?

title: Psalms 119:85
content: 85 The proud have dug pits for me, which is not according to your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:86
content: 86 All your commandments are true; they pursue me deceifully; help me.

title: Psalms 119:87
content: 87 They have almost made an end to me in the land, but as for me, I do not reject your instructions.

title: Psalms 119:88
content: 88 According to your steadfast love, keep me alive, so that I may observe the testimonies of your mouth.

title: Psalms 119:89
content: 89 Forever, Yahweh, your word stands in the heavens.

title: Psalms 119:90
content: 90 Your faithfulness lasts from generation to generation; you have established the earth, and it stands.

title: Psalms 119:91
content: 91 They stand for your judgments today, for all things are your servants.

title: Psalms 119:92
content: 92 If your teaching had not been my delight, then I would have perished in my affliction.

title: Psalms 119:93
content: 93 I will not forget your precepts forever, for through them you have preserved me alive.

title: Psalms 119:94
content: 94 I am yours; save me, for I seek your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:95
content: 95 The wicked wait for me in order to destroy me, but I seek to understand your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:96
content: 96 I have seen an end for all perfection; your commandments are very broad.

title: Psalms 119:97
content: 97 Oh how I love your teaching! It is my meditation all day long.

title: Psalms 119:98
content: 98 Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, for it is with me forever.

title: Psalms 119:99
content: 99 I have more understanding than all my teachers, for your testimonies are my meditation.

title: Psalms 119:100
content: 100 I understand more than the elders; for I have kept your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:101
content: 101 I have restrained my feet from every path of evil so that I might observe your word.

title: Psalms 119:102
content: 102 I have not turned aside from your judgments, for you alone have instructed me.

title: Psalms 119:103
content: 103 How sweet are your promises to my taste, yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

title: Psalms 119:104
content: 104 Through your precepts I gain understanding; therefore I hate every path of falsehood.

title: Psalms 119:105
content: 105 Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path.

title: Psalms 119:106
content: 106 I have sworn and have confirmed it, that I will observe your righteous judgments.

title: Psalms 119:107
content: 107 I am very afflicted; keep me alive, Yahweh, according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:108
content: 108 Yahweh, please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, and teach me your judgments.

title: Psalms 119:109
content: 109 My life is in my palm continually, yet I do not forget your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:110
content: 110 The wicked have set a snare for me, but I have not strayed from your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:111
content: 111 I claim your testimonies as my heritage forever, for they are the joy of my heart.

title: Psalms 119:112
content: 112 I incline my heart to do your statutes forever, to the end!

title: Psalms 119:113
content: 113 I hate double-minded people, but I love your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:114
content: 114 You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.

title: Psalms 119:115
content: 115 Get away from me, you evil doers, so that I may observe the commandments of my God.

title: Psalms 119:116
content: 116 Sustain me by your word so that I may live and do not make me ashamed of my expectation.

title: Psalms 119:117
content: 117 Sustain me, and I will be saved; And, I will gaze on your statutes continually.

title: Psalms 119:118
content: 118 You reject all those who stray from your statutes, for their deception is in vain.

title: Psalms 119:119
content: 119 You remove all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:120
content: 120 My body trembles in fear of you, and I fear of your judgments.

title: Psalms 119:121
content: 121 I do justice and righteousness; do not abandon me to my oppressors.

title: Psalms 119:122
content: 122 Ensure goodness for your servant; do not let the proud oppress me.

title: Psalms 119:123
content: 123 My eyes faint for your salvation and for the promise of your righteousness.

title: Psalms 119:124
content: 124 Deal with your servant according to your steadfast love, and teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:125
content: 125 I am your servant; give me understanding so that I may know your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:126
content: 126 It is time for Yahweh to act, they break your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:127
content: 127 Therefore, I love your commandments more than gold, more than fine gold.

title: Psalms 119:128
content: 128 Therefore I consider all your precepts to be right in everything. I hate every path of falsehood.

title: Psalms 119:129
content: 129 Your testimonies are wonderful. Therefore, I obey them.

title: Psalms 119:130
content: 130 The unfolding of your words gives light; it gives understanding to the untrained.

title: Psalms 119:131
content: 131 I open my mouth and pant, for I long for your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:132
content: 132 Turn to me and be gracious to me according to justice, to those who love your name.

title: Psalms 119:133
content: 133 Establish my footsteps in your promises; and do not let any iniquity rule over me.

title: Psalms 119:134
content: 134 Ransom me from the oppression of man so that I may observe your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:135
content: 135 Let your face shine on your servant, and teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:136
content: 136 Channels of water run down from my eyes because they do not observe your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:137
content: 137 You are righteous, Yahweh, and your judgments are upright.

title: Psalms 119:138
content: 138 You command your testimonies righteously and very faithfully.

title: Psalms 119:139
content: 139 My jealousy has destroyed me because my adversaries forget your words.

title: Psalms 119:140
content: 140 Your promise is well refined, and your servant loves it.

title: Psalms 119:141
content: 141 I am little and despised. I do not forget your instructions.

title: Psalms 119:142
content: 142 Your righteousness is right forever, and your instruction is true.

title: Psalms 119:143
content: 143 Distress and anguish have found me. your commandments are my delight.

title: Psalms 119:144
content: 144 Your testimonies are righteous forever; give me understanding that I may live.

title: Psalms 119:145
content: 145 I cried out with my whole heart, “Answer me, Yahweh, I will keep your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:146
content: 146 I call to you; save me, so that I may observe your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:147
content: 147 I rise before the dawn and cry for help. I hope in your words.

title: Psalms 119:148
content: 148 My eyes are open during the night watches in order to meditate on your promise.

title: Psalms 119:149
content: 149 Hear my voice according to your steadfast love; Yahweh, according to your judgment preserve my life.

title: Psalms 119:150
content: 150 Those pursuing wickedness are coming near. They wander far from your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:151
content: 151 You are near, Yahweh, and all your commandments are true.

title: Psalms 119:152
content: 152 Long ago I learned from your testimonies that you had established them forever.

title: Psalms 119:153
content: 153 Look on my affliction and rescue me, for I do not forget your teaching.

title: Psalms 119:154
content: 154 Plead my cause and redeem me; preserve me for your promise.

title: Psalms 119:155
content: 155 Salvation is far from the wicked, for they do not pursue your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:156
content: 156 Your mercies are many, Yahweh; according to your judgments, preserve me.

title: Psalms 119:157
content: 157 My pursuers and my adversaries are many; from your testimonies I have not turned.

title: Psalms 119:158
content: 158 I see the treacherous and I despise it because they do not observe your promise.

title: Psalms 119:159
content: 159 See that I love your precepts; Yahweh, according to your steadfast love, preserve me.

title: Psalms 119:160
content: 160 The head of your word is truth, and all of your righteous judgments lasts forever.

title: Psalms 119:161
content: 161 Commanders pursue me without cause, but from your word my heart trembles

title: Psalms 119:162
content: 162 I rejoice on account of your promise, like one who finds great plunder.

title: Psalms 119:163
content: 163 I hate falsehood, and I loathe it. I love your instruction.

title: Psalms 119:164
content: 164 Seven times in a day I praise you on account of your righteous judgments.

title: Psalms 119:165
content: 165 Great peace is for those who love your instruction; there is no stumbling for them.

title: Psalms 119:166
content: 166 I wait for your salvation, Yahweh, and I do your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:167
content: 167 My life keeps your testimonies, and I love them greatly.

title: Psalms 119:168
content: 168 I keep your precepts and your testimonies, for all my ways are before you.

title: Psalms 119:169
content: 169 My plea comes near to your face, Yahweh; give me understanding into your word.

title: Psalms 119:170
content: 170 May my supplication come before your face; according to your promise, rescue me.

title: Psalms 119:171
content: 171 May my lips pour out praise, for you teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:172
content: 172 Let my tongue sing about your promise, for all your commandments are right.

title: Psalms 119:173
content: 173 Let your hand be for my help, for I have chosen your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:174
content: 174 I long for your salvation, Yahweh, and your teaching is my delight.

title: Psalms 119:175
content: 175 May I live and praise you, and may your judgments help me.

title: Psalms 119:176
content: 176 I have wandered off like a lost sheep; seek your servant, for I have not forgotten your commandments.”

title: Psalms 120:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. To Yahweh in my distress I called, and he answered me.

title: Psalms 120:2
content: 2 Rescue my life, Yahweh, from a lip of falsehood, from a tongue of deceit.

title: Psalms 120:3
content: 3 What will he give to you, and what will he add to you, tongue of deceit?

title: Psalms 120:4
content: 4 Sharpened arrows of a warrior, along with burning coals of a broom tree.

title: Psalms 120:5
content: 5 Woe to me, for I sojourned in Meshech, I dwelled among the tents of Kedar.

title: Psalms 120:6
content: 6 My life has dwelt for a long time with haters of peace.

title: Psalms 120:7
content: 7 I {am for} peace, but when I speak, they {are} for war.

title: Psalms 121:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. I lift up my eyes to the mountains, From where does my help come?

title: Psalms 121:2
content: 2 My help is from with Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 121:3
content: 3 May he not appoint your foot for slipping. May the one who protects you not slumber.

title: Psalms 121:4
content: 4 Behold, the one who guards Israel will never slumber and will never sleep.

title: Psalms 121:5
content: 5 Yahweh is the one who guards you. Yahweh is your shade at your right hand.

title: Psalms 121:6
content: 6 The sun will not harm you daily, nor the moon during the night.

title: Psalms 121:7
content: 7 Yahweh will protect you from all harm, he will protect your life.

title: Psalms 121:8
content: 8 Yahweh will protect your going and your coming from now and until forever.

title: Psalms 122:1
content: 1 A song of ascents, of David. I rejoiced when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of Yahweh.”

title: Psalms 122:2
content: 2 Jerusalem, our feet are standing within your gates!

title: Psalms 122:3
content: 3 Jerusalem, which is built as a city bound together,

title: Psalms 122:4
content: 4 which is where the tribes went up to, the tribes of Yah, {because of} the testimony to Israel to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 122:5
content: 5 For there thrones of judgment remained, thrones of the house of David.

title: Psalms 122:6
content: 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem! May those who love you have peace.

title: Psalms 122:7
content: 7 May there be peace within your walls, peace within your fortresses.

title: Psalms 122:8
content: 8 For the sake of my brothers and my friends I will say, “May there be peace within you.”

title: Psalms 122:9
content: 9 For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God I will seek your good.

title: Psalms 123:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents To you I lift up my eyes, you who are enthroned in the heavens.

title: Psalms 123:2
content: 2 See, as the eyes of servants look to their master’s hand, as the eyes of a maid look to her mistress’s hand, so our eyes look to Yahweh our God until he has mercy on us.

title: Psalms 123:3
content: 3 Have mercy on us, Yahweh, have mercy on us, for we are exceedingly filled with humiliation.

title: Psalms 123:4
content: 4 We are more than full of the scoffing of the insolent and with the contempt of the proud.

title: Psalms 124:1
content: 1 A song of ascents; of David. A Song of Ascents of David “If Yahweh had not been on our side,” let Israel say now,

title: Psalms 124:2
content: 2 “if it had not been Yahweh who was on our side when men rose up against us,

title: Psalms 124:3
content: 3 then they would have swallowed us up alive when their anger raged against us.

title: Psalms 124:4
content: 4 Then the water would have swept us away; the torrent would have gone over us.

title: Psalms 124:5
content: 5 Then the raging waters would have gone over us.”

title: Psalms 124:6
content: 6 Blessed be Yahweh, who has not allowed us to be torn by their teeth.

title: Psalms 124:7
content: 7 We have escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; the snare has been broken, and we have escaped.

title: Psalms 124:8
content: 8 Our help is in the name of Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 125:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents Those who trust in Yahweh are like Mount Zion, which cannot be shaken, forever enduring.

title: Psalms 125:2
content: 2 As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the Lord surrounds his people now and forever.

title: Psalms 125:3
content: 3 The scepter of wickedness must not rest on the land alloted to the righteous. Otherwise the righteous might reach out their hands to do what is wrong.

title: Psalms 125:4
content: 4 Do good, Yahweh, to those who are good and to those who are upright in their hearts.

title: Psalms 125:5
content: 5 But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways, Yahweh will lead them away with those who do evil. May peace be on Israel.

title: Psalms 126:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents When Yahweh restored the fortunes of Zion, we were like those who dream.

title: Psalms 126:2
content: 2 Then our mouths were filled with laughter and our tongues with singing. Then they said among the nations, “Yahweh has done great things for them.”

title: Psalms 126:3
content: 3 Yahweh did great things for us; how glad we were!

title: Psalms 126:4
content: 4 Restore our fortunes, Yahweh, like the streams in the Negev.

title: Psalms 126:5
content: 5 Those who sow in tears will reap with shouts of joy.

title: Psalms 126:6
content: 6 He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing, will return again with shouts of joy, bringing his bundles of grain with him.

title: Psalms 127:1
content: 1 A song of ascents, of Solomon. A Song of Ascents of Solomon If Yahweh is not the builder of the house, they work uselessly, those who build it. If it is not Yahweh who guards the city, the watchman stands guard uselessly.

title: Psalms 127:2
content: 2 It is useless for you to rise up early, to come home late, or to eat the bread of hard work, for Yahweh provides for his beloved as they sleep.

title: Psalms 127:3
content: 3 See, children are a heritage from Yahweh, and the fruit of the womb is a reward.

title: Psalms 127:4
content: 4 Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, so are the children of one’s youth.

title: Psalms 127:5
content: 5 How blessed is the man that has his quiver full of them. He will not be put to shame when he confronts his enemies in the gate.

title: Psalms 128:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents Blessed is everyone who honors Yahweh, who walks in his ways.

title: Psalms 128:2
content: 2 When you eat the labor of your hands, you will enjoy; you will be blessed and prosper.

title: Psalms 128:3
content: 3 Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in your house; your children will be like olive plants as they sit around your table.

title: Psalms 128:4
content: 4 Yes, indeed, the man will be blessed who honors Yahweh.

title: Psalms 128:5
content: 5 May Yahweh bless you from Zion; may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life.

title: Psalms 128:6
content: 6 May you live to see your children’s children. May peace be on Israel.

title: Psalms 129:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents “Often since my youth they have attacked me,” let Israel say.

title: Psalms 129:2
content: 2 “Often since my youth they have attacked me, yet they have not defeated me.

title: Psalms 129:3
content: 3 The plowers plowed on my back; they made their furrows long.

title: Psalms 129:4
content: 4 Yahweh is righteous; he has cut the ropes of the wicked.”

title: Psalms 129:5
content: 5 May they all be put to shame and turned back, those who hate Zion.

title: Psalms 129:6
content: 6 May they be like the grass on the housetops that withers before it grows up,

title: Psalms 129:7
content: 7 that cannot fill the reaper’s hand or the chest of the one who binds bundles of grain together.

title: Psalms 129:8
content: 8 May those who pass by not say, “May the blessing of Yahweh be on you; we bless you in the name of Yahweh.”

title: Psalms 130:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents Out of the depths I cry to you, Yahweh.

title: Psalms 130:2
content: 2 Lord, hear my voice; let your ears be attentive to my pleas for mercy.

title: Psalms 130:3
content: 3 If you, Yahweh, would mark iniquities, Lord, who could stand?

title: Psalms 130:4
content: 4 But there is forgiveness with you, that you may be revered.

title: Psalms 130:5
content: 5 I wait for Yahweh, my soul waits, and in his word I hope.

title: Psalms 130:6
content: 6 My soul waits for the Lord more than watchmen wait for the morning.

title: Psalms 130:7
content: 7 Israel, hope in Yahweh. Yahweh is merciful, for with Yahweh is abundant redemption.

title: Psalms 130:8
content: 8 It is he who will redeem Israel from all his sins.

title: Psalms 131:1
content: 1 A song of ascents; of David. [A Song of the Ascents, of David] Yahweh, my heart does not boast nor do my eyes look too high, nor do I walk in great and marvelous things beyond me.

title: Psalms 131:2
content: 2 Have I not stilled and quieted my inner being like a weaned child with his mother, my inner being within me is like a weaned child.

title: Psalms 131:3
content: 3 Israel, hope in Yahweh from now on and forevermore.

title: Psalms 132:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of Ascents Yahweh, for David’s sake, remember all his afflictions.

title: Psalms 132:2
content: 2 how he swore to Yahweh, how he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob.

title: Psalms 132:3
content: 3 Surely I will not enter the tent of my house nor go up to the spread of my bed,

title: Psalms 132:4
content: 4 Nor will I give sleep to my eyes or rest to my eyelids

title: Psalms 132:5
content: 5 until I find a place for Yahweh, a tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

title: Psalms 132:6
content: 6 Look, we heard about it in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar.

title: Psalms 132:7
content: 7 We will go into his tabernacle; we will worship at the footstool of his feet.

title: Psalms 132:8
content: 8 Arise, Yahweh, to your resting place, you and the ark of your strength!

title: Psalms 132:9
content: 9 May your priests be clothed with righteousness; may your faithful ones shout for joy.

title: Psalms 132:10
content: 10 For your servant David’s sake, do not turn away from the face of your anointed one.

title: Psalms 132:11
content: 11 Yahweh swore a sure oath to David, he will not turn from it: “From the fruit of your belly I will set on your throne.

title: Psalms 132:12
content: 12 If your sons keep my covenant and the laws that I will teach them, their children also will sit on your throne forevermore.”

title: Psalms 132:13
content: 13 For Yahweh has chosen Zion, he has desired her as a dwelling for him.

title: Psalms 132:14
content: 14 “This is my resting place forever. I will dwell here, for I desire her.

title: Psalms 132:15
content: 15 With wild game I will abundantly bless her. I will satisfy her poor with bread.

title: Psalms 132:16
content: 16 I will clothe her priests with salvation, her faithful ones will shout aloud for joy.

title: Psalms 132:17
content: 17 There I will make a horn to sprout for David and set up a lamp for my anointed one.

title: Psalms 132:18
content: 18 I will clothe his enemies with shame, but on him his crown will shine.”

title: Psalms 133:1
content: 1 A song of ascents, of David. [A Song of the Ascents, Of David] Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to live together!

title: Psalms 133:2
content: 2 It is like fine oil on the head pouring down on the beard— Aaron’s beard, which pours down on the collar of his robes.

title: Psalms 133:3
content: 3 It is like the dew of Hermon which falls on the mountains of Zion. For there Yahweh commanded the blessing— life forevermore.

title: Psalms 134:1
content: 1 A song of ascents. A Song of the Ascents Behold, bless Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh, you who stand in the night in the house of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 134:2
content: 2 Lift up your hands to the holy place and bless Yahweh.

title: Psalms 134:3
content: 3 May Yahweh bless you from Zion, he who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 135:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Praise the name of Yahweh. Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,

title: Psalms 135:2
content: 2 you who stand in the house of Yahweh, in the courtyards of the house of our God.

title: Psalms 135:3
content: 3 Praise Yahweh, for Yahweh is good; sing praises to his name, for it is pleasant.

title: Psalms 135:4
content: 4 For Yahweh has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel as his possession.

title: Psalms 135:5
content: 5 For I myself know that Yahweh is great, and our Lord is greater than all other gods.

title: Psalms 135:6
content: 6 All that Yahweh desires, he does in the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and all the ocean depths.

title: Psalms 135:7
content: 7 Causing the clouds to rise from the end of the earth, he makes lightning accompany the rain and bringing the wind out of his storehouse.

title: Psalms 135:8
content: 8 He struck the firstborn of Egypt, from man to beast.

title: Psalms 135:9
content: 9 He sent signs and wonders into your midst, Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.

title: Psalms 135:10
content: 10 He struck many nations and killed mighty kings,

title: Psalms 135:11
content: 11 Sihon king of the Amorites and Og king of Bashan and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

title: Psalms 135:12
content: 12 And he gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to Israel his people.

title: Psalms 135:13
content: 13 Your name, Yahweh, endures forever; your renown, Yahweh, endures from generation to generation.

title: Psalms 135:14
content: 14 For Yahweh judges his people, and he shows compassion on his servants.

title: Psalms 135:15
content: 15 The nations’ idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

title: Psalms 135:16
content: 16 Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;

title: Psalms 135:17
content: 17 they have ears, but they do not hear, nor is there breath in their mouths.

title: Psalms 135:18
content: 18 Those who make them are like them, as is everyone who trusts in them.

title: Psalms 135:19
content: 19 House of Israel, bless Yahweh; house of Aaron, bless Yahweh.

title: Psalms 135:20
content: 20 House of Levi, bless Yahweh; you who fear Yahweh, bless Yahweh.

title: Psalms 135:21
content: 21 Blessed be Yahweh in Zion, he who lives in Jerusalem. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 136:1
content: 1 Oh, give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:2
content: 2 Oh, give thanks to the God of gods, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:3
content: 3 Oh, give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:4
content: 4 To him who alone does great wonders, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:5
content: 5 to him who by wisdom made the heavens, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:6
content: 6 To him who spread out the earth above the waters, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:7
content: 7 to him who made great lights, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:8
content: 8 the sun to rule by day, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:9
content: 9 the moon and stars to rule by night, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:10
content: 10 to him who struck Egypt in their firstborn, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:11
content: 11 and brought out Israel from among them, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:12
content: 12 with a strong hand and a raised arm, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:13
content: 13 to him who divided the Sea of Reeds into parts, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:14
content: 14 and made Israel to pass through the middle of it, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:15
content: 15 and threw down Pharaoh and his army in the Sea of Reeds, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:16
content: 16 to him who led his people through the wilderness, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:17
content: 17 to him who struck down great kings, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:18
content: 18 to him who killed powerful kings, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:19
content: 19 Sihon king of the Amorites, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:20
content: 20 and Og king of Bashan, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:21
content: 21 to him who gave their land as an inheritance, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:22
content: 22 an inheritance to Israel his servant, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:23
content: 23 who remembered us in our low estate, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:24
content: 24 and he rescued us from our adversaries, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—

title: Psalms 136:25
content: 25 giving bread to all flesh, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:26
content: 26 Oh, give thanks to the God of heaven, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

title: Psalms 137:1
content: 1 Beside the rivers of Babylon there we sat and wept when we remembered Zion.

title: Psalms 137:2
content: 2 On the poplars there we hung our harps.

title: Psalms 137:3
content: 3 For there our captors demanded that we sing songs, and those who relentlessly mocked us said, “Sing to us from the songs of Zion.”

title: Psalms 137:4
content: 4 How could we sing a song about Yahweh in a foreign land?

title: Psalms 137:5
content: 5 If I forget you, Jerusalem, let my right hand forget

title: Psalms 137:6
content: 6 Let my tongue cling to my palate if I do not remember you, if I do not lift up Jerusalem over my chief pleasure.

title: Psalms 137:7
content: 7 Remember, Yahweh, the sons of Edom, on the day of Jerusalem, saying, “Tear it down, tear it down to its foundations.”

title: Psalms 137:8
content: 8 Daughter of Babylon, who will be destroyed— blessed be the one who repays you for what you have done to us.

title: Psalms 137:9
content: 9 Blessed be the one who seizes and dashes your little ones against the rocks.

title: Psalms 138:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. Of David I will give you thanks with my whole heart; before the gods I will sing praises to you.

title: Psalms 138:2
content: 2 I will bow down toward the temple of your holiness, and I will give thanks to your name for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness. For you have exalted above all things your name and your word.

title: Psalms 138:3
content: 3 On the day that I called and you answered me; you emboldened my life with power.

title: Psalms 138:4
content: 4 All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, Yahweh, for they will hear the words from your mouth.

title: Psalms 138:5
content: 5 Indeed, they will sing of the ways of Yahweh, for great is the glory of Yahweh.

title: Psalms 138:6
content: 6 For though Yahweh is high, yet he sees the lowly, but the proud he knows from far off.

title: Psalms 138:7
content: 7 Though I walk in the middle of danger, you will preserve my life; you will reach out with your hand against the anger of my enemies, and your right hand will save me.

title: Psalms 138:8
content: 8 Yahweh is with me to the end; your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, endures forever. Do not forsake the ones whom your hands have made.

title: Psalms 139:1
content: 1 For the chief musician. A psalm of David. For the choir director, a psalm of David. Yahweh, you have examined me, and you know.

title: Psalms 139:2
content: 2 You know when I sit and when I rise; you understand my thoughts from far away.

title: Psalms 139:3
content: 3 You have measured my path and my resting places; and you are familiar with all my ways.

title: Psalms 139:4
content: 4 For there is not a word on my tongue ..., See, you know it completely, Yahweh.

title: Psalms 139:5
content: 5 Behind and before you encircle me and you place your hand upon me.

title: Psalms 139:6
content: 6 Such knowledge is too wonderful for me! it is high; I cannot reach it.

title: Psalms 139:7
content: 7 Where can I go from your Spirit? Where can I flee from your presence?

title: Psalms 139:8
content: 8 If I ascend up to the heavens, you are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there.

title: Psalms 139:9
content: 9 If I rise on the wings of the morning or dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

title: Psalms 139:10
content: 10 even there your hand will lead me, your right hand will hold on to me.

title: Psalms 139:11
content: 11 If I said, “Surely the darkness will cover me, and the light will become night around me,”

title: Psalms 139:12
content: 12 even the darkness would not be dark to you, and night would shine like the day. The darkness is like the light to you!

title: Psalms 139:13
content: 13 For You created my inner parts; you wove me together in my mother’s womb.

title: Psalms 139:14
content: 14 I will praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful. My inner being knows this very well.

title: Psalms 139:15
content: 15 My bones were not hidden from you when I was made in private, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth.

title: Psalms 139:16
content: 16 Your eyes saw my unformed body; all the days formed for me were recorded in your book even before the first of them was.

title: Psalms 139:17
content: 17 How precious are your thoughts to me, God! How vast is their sum!

title: Psalms 139:18
content: 18 If I counted them, they would be more numberous than the sand. When I awake, I am still with you.

title: Psalms 139:19
content: 19 If only you would kill the wicked, God; and you men of bloodshed, get away from me.

title: Psalms 139:20
content: 20 For they speak against you with evil intent; your enemies abuse your character

title: Psalms 139:21
content: 21 Do I not hate those, Yahweh, who hate you? Do I not despise those who rise up against you?

title: Psalms 139:22
content: 22 I hate them completely; they have become my enemies.

title: Psalms 139:23
content: 23 Examine me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my thoughts.

title: Psalms 139:24
content: 24 See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the path of forever.

title: Psalms 140:1
content: 1 For the chief musician. A psalm of David. Yahweh, rescue me from men of wickedness; preserve me from men of violence.

title: Psalms 140:2
content: 2 For they plan evil in their hearts; they assemble for battles every day.

title: Psalms 140:3
content: 3 Their tongues pierce like a serpent; vipers’ poison is on their lips. Selah

title: Psalms 140:4
content: 4 Keep me from the hands of the wicked, Yahweh; preserve me from men of violence who plan to push down my step.

title: Psalms 140:5
content: 5 The proud have set a trap for me; and with ropes they have spread a net by hand along the path; they have set snares for me.

title: Psalms 140:6
content: 6 I said to Yahweh, “You are my God; Yahweh, give ear to my cries for mercy.”

title: Psalms 140:7
content: 7 Yahweh, my Lord, you are the strength of my salvation; you shield my head in the day of battle.

title: Psalms 140:8
content: 8 Yahweh, do not grant the desires of the wicked; do not promote their plots, they rise up

title: Psalms 140:9
content: 9 Those who surround me raise their heads; let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

title: Psalms 140:10
content: 10 Let burning coals fall on them; throw them into the fire, into bottomless pits, never again will they rise.

title: Psalms 140:11
content: 11 May men of tongues not be established in the land; may evil hunt down the man of violence speedily.

title: Psalms 140:12
content: 12 I know that Yahweh will act with favor for the poor, justice to the needy.

title: Psalms 140:13
content: 13 Surely the righteous will praise your name; the upright will dwell before your face.

title: Psalms 141:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. A song of David Yahweh, I called out to you, "Come quickly to me. Give ear to my voice when I call to you."

title: Psalms 141:2
content: 2 May my prayer rise like incense to your face; may my lifted hands be like the evening sacrifice.

title: Psalms 141:3
content: 3 Yahweh, place a guard over my mouth; guard the door of my lips.

title: Psalms 141:4
content: 4 Do not let my heart bend toward any evil thing or participate in sinful activities with men who behave wickedly. May I not eat any of their delicacies.

title: Psalms 141:5
content: 5 Let a righteous person hit me; it will be a kindness. Let him correct me; it will be like oil on my head. May my head not refuse. For my prayer is always against their wicked deeds.

title: Psalms 141:6
content: 6 Their judges will stumble into the hands of craggy rocks; they will hear that my own words are pleasant.

title: Psalms 141:7
content: 7 “As when one plows and breaks up the ground, so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.”

title: Psalms 141:8
content: 8 For my eyes are on you, Yahweh, Lord; in you I take refuge; do not abandon my life.

title: Psalms 141:9
content: 9 Keep me from the hands of the snare that they have laid for me, from the traps of evildoers.

title: Psalms 141:10
content: 10 Let the wicked fall into their own nets while I escape.

title: Psalms 142:1
content: 1 A maschil of David, when he was in the cave; a prayer. With my voice I cry out to Yahweh; with my voice I plead to Yahweh for favor.

title: Psalms 142:2
content: 2 I pour out my lament before him; I declare my troubles before him.

title: Psalms 142:3
content: 3 When my spirit is weak within me, you yourself know my path. Along this path I walk they have hidden a trap for me.

title: Psalms 142:4
content: 4 I look to my right and see that there is no one who cares for me. there is no refuge for me; no one looks after my life.

title: Psalms 142:5
content: 5 I called out to you, Yahweh; I said, “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.

title: Psalms 142:6
content: 6 Listen to my cries, for I have been brought very low; rescue me from my pursuers, for they are stronger than I.

title: Psalms 142:7
content: 7 Bring my life out of prison in order to praise your name. The righteous will gather around me because you have been good to me.”

title: Psalms 143:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. A song of David Hear my prayer, Yahweh; listen to my pleas. On account of your faithfulness answer me in your righteousness!

title: Psalms 143:2
content: 2 Do not enter into judgment with your servant, for no one living is righteous before you.

title: Psalms 143:3
content: 3 For the enemy has pursued my being; he has crushed my life to the ground; he has made me to live in dark places like those dead a long time.

title: Psalms 143:4
content: 4 My breath is faint in me; my heart despairs within me.

title: Psalms 143:5
content: 5 I remember days from old; I meditate on all your works; I reflect on the works of your hands.

title: Psalms 143:6
content: 6 I spread my hands out to you; my soul thirsts for you as in a parched land.

title: Psalms 143:7
content: 7 Answer me quickly, Yahweh, because my spirit faints. Do not hide your face from me, or I will become like those who go down into the pit.

title: Psalms 143:8
content: 8 Let me hear your covenant faithfulness in the morning, for I trust in you. Make known to me the way where I should walk, for I lift up my soul to you.

title: Psalms 143:9
content: 9 Rescue me from my enemies, Yahweh; I hide in you.

title: Psalms 143:10
content: 10 Teach me to do your good pleasures, for you are my God. May your spirit of goodness lead me in the land of uprightness.

title: Psalms 143:11
content: 11 Yahweh, for the sake of your name, keep me alive; in your righteousness bring my life out of trouble.

title: Psalms 143:12
content: 12 In your covenant faithfulness cut off my enemies and destroy all the enemies of my life, for I am your servant.

title: Psalms 144:1
content: 1 A psalm of David. Of David. Blessed be Yahweh, my rock, who trains my hands for war and my fingers for battle.

title: Psalms 144:2
content: 2 You are my steadfast love and my fortress, my high tower and the one who rescues me, my shield and the one in whom I take refuge, the one who subdues nations under me.

title: Psalms 144:3
content: 3 Yahweh, what is man that you take notice of him, the son of man that you think about him?

title: Psalms 144:4
content: 4 Man is like a breath; his days are like a passing shadow.

title: Psalms 144:5
content: 5 Yahweh, cause your sky to spread wide and come down; touch the mountains and make them smoke.

title: Psalms 144:6
content: 6 Shoot lightning and scatter them; send your bolts and disturb them.

title: Psalms 144:7
content: 7 Reach out your hand from above, deliver me and rescue me out of many waters, from the hand of sons of foreigners.

title: Psalms 144:8
content: 8 For their mouths speak lies, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

title: Psalms 144:9
content: 9 I will sing a new song to you, God; on a lute of ten strings I will play for you,

title: Psalms 144:10
content: 10 who gives salvation to kings, who rescues David your servant from an evil sword.

title: Psalms 144:11
content: 11 Rescue me and deliver me from the hand of sons of foreigners. For their mouths speak lies, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

title: Psalms 144:12
content: 12 May our sons be like plants who grow large in their youth and our daughters like carved corner pillars, resembling a palace.

title: Psalms 144:13
content: 13 May our storehouses be full with every kind of produce, and may our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.

title: Psalms 144:14
content: 14 May our oxen have many young. No one will break through, no one will go out, and no one will cry in our streets.

title: Psalms 144:15
content: 15 Blessed is the people for whom this is so; blessed is the people for whom Yahweh is his God.

title: Psalms 145:1
content: 1 A psalm of praise. Of David. A song of David I will extol you, my God, the King; I will bless your name forever and ever.

title: Psalms 145:2
content: 2 Every day will I bless you; I will praise your name forever and ever.

title: Psalms 145:3
content: 3 Great is Yahweh and greatly to be praised; and his greatness cannot be measured.

title: Psalms 145:4
content: 4 Generation to generation will rejoice because of your deeds and they will proclaim your mighty actions.

title: Psalms 145:5
content: 5 On the glorious splendor of your majesty and on your marvelous deeds, I will meditate.

title: Psalms 145:6
content: 6 They will speak of the power of your awesome works, and I will declare your greatness.

title: Psalms 145:7
content: 7 They will celebrate the fame of your abounding goodness, and they will sing about your righteousness.

title: Psalms 145:8
content: 8 Yahweh is gracious and merciful, slow to anger and great in steadfast love.

title: Psalms 145:9
content: 9 Yahweh is good to all; and his abundant mercies are over all his works.

title: Psalms 145:10
content: 10 All you have made will give thanks to you, Yahweh; your faithful ones will bless you.

title: Psalms 145:11
content: 11 They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and they will tell of your power.

title: Psalms 145:12
content: 12 Making known to the children of mankind his mighty deeds and the glorious splendor of his kingdom.

title: Psalms 145:13
content: 13 Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and your dominion endures throughout all generations.

title: Psalms 145:14
content: 14 Yahweh supports all who are falling and raises up all who are bent over.

title: Psalms 145:15
content: 15 The eyes of all wait for you; you give them their food in its time.

title: Psalms 145:16
content: 16 You open your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.

title: Psalms 145:17
content: 17 Yahweh is righteous in all his ways and faithful in all he does.

title: Psalms 145:18
content: 18 Yahweh is near to all who call to him, to all who call to him in truth.

title: Psalms 145:19
content: 19 He does the desire of those who fear him, and he hears their cry and saves them.

title: Psalms 145:20
content: 20 Yahweh keeps all those who love him, but he will destroy all the wicked.

title: Psalms 145:21
content: 21 My mouth speaks the praise of Yahweh; let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.

title: Psalms 146:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Praise Yahweh, my soul.

title: Psalms 146:2
content: 2 I will praise Yahweh with my life; I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.

title: Psalms 146:3
content: 3 Do not trust in nobles Nor in men, in whom there is no salvation.

title: Psalms 146:4
content: 4 When his breath ceases, he returns to the ground; on that day his plans perish.

title: Psalms 146:5
content: 5 Blessed is the one who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Yahweh his God.

title: Psalms 146:6
content: 6 The one who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them; The one who keeps faithfulness forever.

title: Psalms 146:7
content: 7 The one who executes justice for the oppressed The one who gives bread to the hungry. Yahweh liberates the prisoners;

title: Psalms 146:8
content: 8 Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind; Yahweh raises up those who are bowed down; Yahweh loves those who are righteous.

title: Psalms 146:9
content: 9 Yahweh guards the refugees; he sustains the orphan and the widow, but he subverts the way of the wicked.

title: Psalms 146:10
content: 10 Yahweh reigns forever, your God, Zion, reigns from generation to generation. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 147:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh! How good it is to sing praises to our God, how pleasant and suitable is a song of praise.

title: Psalms 147:2
content: 2 Yahweh builds up Jerusalem, he gathers the scattered people of Israel.

title: Psalms 147:3
content: 3 He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

title: Psalms 147:4
content: 4 He counts the number of the stars; he gives names to all of them.

title: Psalms 147:5
content: 5 Great is our Lord and abounding in power, his understanding is without measure.

title: Psalms 147:6
content: 6 Yahweh lifts up the oppressed, he brings the wicked down to the ground.

title: Psalms 147:7
content: 7 Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving, sing praises to our God with a harp.

title: Psalms 147:8
content: 8 He is the one who covers the heavens with clouds; he is the one who prepares rain for the earth; he is the one who causes the mountains to sprout with grass.

title: Psalms 147:9
content: 9 He gives food to the animals and to the children of the ravens when they call.

title: Psalms 147:10
content: 10 He does not delight in the strength of a horse, he does not enjoy the strong legs of a man.

title: Psalms 147:11
content: 11 Yahweh enjoys those who fear him, those who hope for his steadfast love.

title: Psalms 147:12
content: 12 Extol Yahweh, Jerusalem, praise your God, Zion.

title: Psalms 147:13
content: 13 For he strengthens the bars of your gates, he blesses your children in your midst.

title: Psalms 147:14
content: 14 He sets your borders with peace, he satisfies you with the finest of wheat.

title: Psalms 147:15
content: 15 He sends out his word to the land, his command runs with swiftness.

title: Psalms 147:16
content: 16 He makes the snow like wool, he scatters the frost like ashes.

title: Psalms 147:17
content: 17 He sends out his hail like crumbs, who can stand before his cold?

title: Psalms 147:18
content: 18 He sends out his command and melts them; he makes his wind blow, and the waters flow.

title: Psalms 147:19
content: 19 He proclaimed his word to Jacob, his statutes and his righteous decrees to Israel.

title: Psalms 147:20
content: 20 He has not done so with any other nation, and as for his judgments, they do not know them. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 148:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Praise Yahweh from the heavens; praise him in the heights.

title: Psalms 148:2
content: 2 Praise him, all his angels; praise him, all his hosts.

title: Psalms 148:3
content: 3 Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all you shining stars.

title: Psalms 148:4
content: 4 Praise him, highest heavens and the waters that are above the heavens.

title: Psalms 148:5
content: 5 Let them praise the name of Yahweh, for he commanded, and they were created.

title: Psalms 148:6
content: 6 He has established them forever and ever; he given a decree and it will not pass away.

title: Psalms 148:7
content: 7 Praise Yahweh from the earth, sea monsters and all ocean depths,

title: Psalms 148:8
content: 8 fire and hail, snow and clouds, stormy winds doing his word.

title: Psalms 148:9
content: 9 The mountains and all the hills, The fruit trees and all the cedars,

title: Psalms 148:10
content: 10 animals and all the beasts, reptiles and winged birds.

title: Psalms 148:11
content: 11 kings of the earth and all the peoples, princes and all judges of the earth,

title: Psalms 148:12
content: 12 Young men and also young women, the elderly along with the children.

title: Psalms 148:13
content: 13 let them all praise the name of Yahweh, for his name alone is exalted; his glory extends over the earth and the heavens.

title: Psalms 148:14
content: 14 He has raised up the horn of his people praise from all his faithful ones, from the children of Israel, the people near to him. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 149:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Sing to Yahweh a new song – his praise in the assembly of the faithful ones.

title: Psalms 149:2
content: 2 Let Israel rejoice in the one who made them; let the children of Zion rejoice in their king.

title: Psalms 149:3
content: 3 Let them praise his name with dancing; let them play for him with tambourine and harp.

title: Psalms 149:4
content: 4 For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people; he glorifies the humble with salvation.

title: Psalms 149:5
content: 5 Let the faithful ones rejoice in this honor; let them shout for joy on their beds.

title: Psalms 149:6
content: 6 May the exaltation of God be in their throats and two-edged swords in their hands

title: Psalms 149:7
content: 7 to do vengeance on the nations – acts of punishment on the peoples.

title: Psalms 149:8
content: 8 to bind their kings with chains and their honored ones with iron shackles.

title: Psalms 149:9
content: 9 to do the judgment against them that is written. This will be an honor for all his faithful ones. Praise Yahweh.

title: Psalms 150:1
content: 1 Praise Yahweh. Praise God in his holy place; praise him in the mighty heavens.

title: Psalms 150:2
content: 2 Praise him for his mighty acts; praise him for his surpassing greatness.

title: Psalms 150:3
content: 3 Praise him with the blast of the horn; praise him with lute and harp.

title: Psalms 150:4
content: 4 Praise him with tambourines and dancing; praise him with stringed instruments and wind instruments.

title: Psalms 150:5
content: 5 Praise him with loud cymbals; praise him with high sounding cymbals.

title: Psalms 150:6
content: 6 Let everything that has breath praise Yahweh. Praise Yahweh.
